Aromă medie, cu mult hamei ierbos, frunze uscate, citrice, puțină caramelă și fructe uscate.
Gust cam dur, cu nuanțe pământoase și multă țărână, amăreală moderată și neplăcută, frunze, ceva malț.
Cam neplăcută și dură.
Bottle on beach, 18th June 17. Pours dark Amber. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, bubblegum. Taste is typical Brewdog base, hoppy, citrus, bitter. Amazing amount of flavour for a non alcohol beer. Impressive.

The best low-alcohol beer I have tried (by a country mile). Based on some critical reviews here I maybe need to find others available out there, but based on my own experience it deserves a good rating from me. 330ml bottle from Morrisons, UK. It pours brown with hints of red. Foams nicely with medium carbonation. Woody aroma and a lasting pleasant bitter taste.
Hoppy and bitter in a very unsophisticated way, certainly not one Id try again.

Bottle 330 ml from Waitrose. Floral aromas with hints of pine, popcorn and wood. Big and fluffy white-beige head, and a clear dark amber body. Taste is bitter and very hoppy. High carbonation. Missing sweet fruit or citrus notes. Decent non-alcohol alternative.

Bottle, pours dark amber with a foamy head. Aroma is light toffee malt, loads of pine, light floral and citrus. Taste is quite balanced. The palate is thin, the finish is moderate bitter. Best NA brew Ive had.

33 cl bottle bought at Gourmet Experience Callao, Madrid, served in red wine glass. Pours dark reddish brown. Foamy, nicely lacing, thick off-white cream. Aroma is chestnut, candied sugar, bitter orange, cigar box, honey, pine resin, cedar. Nice carb, fresh acidity, very good long-lingering bitterness. The only reason why Im not giving this incredible low-alcohol full points is that to my palate it is quite watery. Nonetheless, it is so far the best of its category Ive ever tried. Congrats to BrewDog.
Une des meilleures bières sans alcool pour moi, une amertume agréable au début mais qui prend un peu trop le dessus sur les notes dagrumes et litchi présentes.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.
Kolor mocnej herbaty, z małą pianą. W smaku pierwsze wrażenie to nachmielona woda. Jest bardzo cienko, ale można się przyzwyczaić. Daje radę, ale tak ledwo ledwo.

330 ml Bottel. Pours with a clear amber and nice off-white head. 
Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. The nose is quite nice: tropical fruits, orange zest, hops & pines, some caramel. Taste of grapefruit- and orange peels, slightly pine, lots of hops. Very nice bitterness. The nose would have been one of my favouritey in a blind tasting. Good one!

Robe brune et limpide. Pas de mousse. Arômes caramel et résineux, un peu de pamplemousse et de rose. Goût caramel, tofee, fruits confits, le tout est bien fade. Le résineux arrive ensuite. Texture aqueuse,  carbonatation grosse. 
Pas mal pour une bière sans alcool. Buvable sinon.
Tap w Brewdog Warszawa. Przyjemnie pachnie owocami ale i karmelem. Smak umiarkowanie gorzki, trochę słodyczy. Przyjemne jak na styl.

Comment un brasseur comme Brewdog peut-il se compromettre dans une bière sans alcool ???
Deux explications : le business .. ou la science-fiction, sur la planète "nanny state".
En loccurrence, on sest quand même cassé le cul chez Brewdog pour mettre 5 houblons dans 0,5 % abv  il faut être fort !! Nous sommes donc avec une "alcohol free hoppy ale", houblonnée en amarillo, centennial, columbus, cascade, simcoe, plus un dry hopping en amarillo et centennial ..
Excusez du peu et de linconséquence ... Niveau ebu de 45.
Mon exemplaire était à 8 mois avant date, tout frais, avec son étiquette vert émeraude.
Couleur candi brun, caramel foncé, à la clarté nette.
Bulles très grosses, sur les parois.
Mousse beige clair, soyeuse, stable à 3 mm.
Arômes de houblon américain, pamplemousse, lichee, pointe de griotte, fruit de la passion, pointe
deau de rose.
1ère bouche très effacée, triste, où les impressions du nez seffacent comme une étoile filante.
Texture aqueuse.
Arrière-bouche courte, mais qui laisse un peu damertume de parade.
2ème où on passe sur une petite citronnade, avec limpression dune radler.
Arrière-bouche qui séteint sans autre formalité.
La longueur améliore un rien lamertume, mais sans aucun accompagnement fruité.
Jambes à flocons moyens, collantes aux parois.
Alcool : tiens, si je vous dis quil est inefficient, vous ne me croirez pas !!
Finale entre amertume et panaché. 
CONCLUSION : il est dabord bien triste de voir ce genre de réalisation chez un bon brasseur,
il est ensuite inconcevable dans gaspiller dans un tel cadre de lamarillo !!
Moi qui suit contre ce gaspillage, jai été servi un maximum .. 
Quant au style, on peut parler dune "dandy beer" pour "nanny state" ...

Bottle - pours clear dark amber, small white head. smells very good: tropical fruits, spices. the first sip is a total desaster though. this brew is a black hole. its like coca cola zero: you expect it to be like the original and its just sh*t. very sweet malts, nearly no hoppy aromas, cardboard, watery body. its n/a okay, but even in this category there are better choices. this tastes like cold fruit tea.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Clear mahogany, spongy off-white head. Fresh strong orange zest and pine, sticky caramelized sugars - like candy. Dry thin taste - totally devoid of sugars. Everything is based on a moderate piney hop bitterness. Not bad for what it is.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: clear amber with medium off-white head. Aroma: very fruity, grapefruit, citrus, mango, hops. Taste: medium sweetness and high bitterness. Notes of thin coffee, citrus fruits and some earth. Palate: light bodied, thin / watery texture and medium carbonation. Pretty good for a low alcohol beer, especially the aroma. A little bit thin though.
Pours a brown colour. Taste is qyite hoppy with a slight hint of coffee. Body is quite watery

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2017 Pours a coppery amber colour with a small frothy beige head. A hoppy fruity citrus aroma. Thin, watery, little to no malt flavour or sweetness. A bit like cold stewed tea with a citrus resinous hop bitterness and some dryness in the finish. Smells okay but disappointing taste.

La curiosité peut nous amener à faire des choses étranges....comme pousser un amateur de bière à tester une bière sans alcool (ou quasiment sans alcool). Mais il faut dire que laffiche était alléchante : un brasseur de renom : Brewdog, plusieurs houblons dans la recette : Centennial, Amarillo Columbus, Cascade et Simcoe et utilisation de Dry Hopping en Centennial et Amarillo. En verre, le bel ambré couleur merisier, dune parfaite limpidité (EBC aux environs de 32) est encourageant. Leffervescence, pas très poussée et sur des bulles de gros diamètres donne naissance à une mousse se stabilisant à 5 minimètres dépaisseur : tout à fait honorable. Le nez surprend alors;, dune symphonie aromatique de toute beauté donnant beaucoup despoirs. Fruits exotiques, pamplemousse, litchi, griottes et rose sassemblent dans une parfaite harmonie. On ne peut alors que se presser den arriver à la première gorgée devant tant de promesses....Et plus importante est alors la déception pour une dégustation plate, quasiment sans saveur. Lattaque est aqueuse sur de très faibles notes de litchi et de fruits exotiques. Seul larrière bouche arrive à sauver du naufrage présentant une touche légèrement amère houblonnée. La deuxième bouche nous enfonce un peu plus. Celle-ci perd encore du volume (et oui, cela est possible) sur des arômes insipides. La troisième bouche présente heureusement une légère amertume. Celle ci est cependant sans arôme, sur une ligne purement amère. LIBU présentée à 45 laisse perplexe, le ressenti étant bien moindre (provenant très certainement de labsence darômes). De façon surprenante cependant, la sensation damertume augmente très légèrement au cours de la dégustation (jai bien indiqué très légèrement!). Le sucre est quant à lui peu présent et aurait finalement peut être gagné à être poussé. Nous en arrivons donc au final, court, avec une amertume retombant très vite. Je me pose donc deux questions. Quel est lintérêt pour Brewdog de commercialiser un tel produit et de gâcher du houblon pour un tel résultat? Si vous insistez vraiment, mettez tout de même un sirop de votre choix pour agrémenter cette bière.

Look: clear copper with stable white head.

Aroma: sweet citruses, candies.
Taste: dry with light bitterness.
Flavour: grapefruit, resin, candied orange peel.
Some metal in the aftertaste.

Very good.

The beer looks very nice. The looks are quite normal for a hoppy ale. The color of the beer is a rather reddish amber. The beer is very clear. On top of the beer a slightly off white layer of soft but rough foam is formed. The bulk of the foam collapses quickly, leaving a thin drape. A lot of foam sticks to the edges of the glass. Not bad.
The smell of the beer is American Pale Ale like. You dont smell that the beer is almost alcohol free. And despite the low amount of malts, I do smell a malty base, giving the beer some sweeter touches and a tiny tastiness. On top of this, there are delicious hop aromas. I smell New World hops, with aromas of pine and some citrus aromas. Not bad. It is a tiny bit more shallow than full beers, but it is not bad. 
The taste of the beer is also nice. It is a bit shallow. The hops are a bit less flavourful and also the malts are a bit weak. The beer does have a strong bitterness though. It the end there is a remarkable savoury thingy going on. But for a low alcohol beer, not bad. 
The palate is average. Rather low body, a bit thin texture, and medium to high carbonation. The finish has a nice bitterness. It misses some alcohol, which is very logical, because it just isnt there.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2017 Dark bronze, nutty brown colour. Big, fuzzy head. Clear. Very hoppy aroma of grapefruit and sweet tropical fruit. Seems You can even smell how bitter this beer is. Taste is not that bitter: watery, hoppy, with notes of yesterdays cold tea. Easy drinking, refreshing, but not the best.

W miarę dobrze pachnie i wygląda, ale w smaku jest słabo. W zapachu czai się sporo chmielu. W smaku niestety duża wodnistość, nuty cytrynowe i dosyć tępa, toporna goryczka. Trochę jakby źle zaparzona herbata. Wysycenie średnie. Nie dla mnie.
Bottle from waitrose Peterborough. Nose is citrus, apricot. Palate is starts bitter hoppy, but really bitter and grainy in the end. Interesting choice for a low alcohol version. But not for me.

F: big, tan, average to good retention.
C: dark coppery, clear.
A: citrus, lemon grass, tropical fruit, pine.
T: very hoppy bitter even at the beginning, I like hoppy beer but this is just pure resinous bitterness with very little tones from aroma but for low alcohol beer quite unusual, almost no body beside the bitterness, this is controversial beer slightly above average for me, 330ml bottle from AH supermarket in Antwerpen.

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours clear, dark, red/brown-ish amber with half a finger or so of somewhat soapy off-white head, which retains well. Patchy lacing and a small amount of carb visible. Aroma is lightly sweet with a fair amount of citrus-y, grassy, resinous hops, and an ever so slight roasty earten bitter edge. Taste is more or less 100% bitter, grassy hops. Grainy, earthen, slightly medicinal edge to the taste, bit of iodine almost. Dead leaves, bark. Almost completely empty of malt obviously but theres the tiniest hint of creamy sweetness. Finish is bone dry with astringent rubbery bitterness lasting ages. Body is light, texture is watery, carbonation is light, basically feels like drinking sparkling water as expected. As many of alluded to its hard to judge low/non-alcohol stuff but this is pretty good for what it is, and packs a hop character comparable to many regular beers. Would be my go-to if for whatever unthinkable reason Im forced to give up drinking...
Gyllent med fint skum. Masse frukt i duften, spesielt mango og ananas. Også en frisk og fruktig smak med noe karamell og en lett bitter avslutning. Veldig tynn.

Amber clear with small off-white head. Nice hoppy aroma with citrus notes. So dar almost excellent. Unfortunately in the taste apart of bitterness there are no other tastes and the drink itself is too watery.

I find this a bit tricky to judge on its merits, as I want to judge it as a beer. Here goes. It pours an oddly dark mahogany, with a generous, persistent head. Nose is very promising, loads of bitter hops plus a roasty note. Taste is odd, empty and yet also very bitter. Its a solid traditional bitterness, neither dank, nor tropical, nor resinous, but just old fashioned bitter. Palate is good, very clean, but rather on the light side. Overall a very decent effort.

Appearance: Medium brown, some light tan head.
Aroma: Hops, light fruits, grains.
Taste: Grains, some hops. Light fruits. Grainy bitter aftertaste. Expected more, but decent.
Bought: Drinks of the World (Online), 330 ml, CHF 3.70
Info: 10/2-2017, BB: 25/3-2017

Bottle from a supermarket. So what do you judge this against? Compared to the mythic phantom of beer perfect, this is OK but not great. Compared to an average NABLAB (no alcohol low alcohol beer) it is a masterstroke. A beer I can drink when I dont feel like having alcohol. So I rate it high.

Poured from a 33cl bottle. Is a deep copper-brown with a minimal tanned white head. Medium low malty caramel and a slightly more hoppy citrus flavour. Very light bodied and watery. Decent level of bitterness, with little sweetness. Doesnt even compete with most beers, but as a non-alcoholic version it is still very satisfying.

Aroma: light caramel, citrus and hay. Some tropical fruit sweets.
Appearance: head dissipates quickly, pours a dark copper / light brown colour.
Taste: decently bitter, with just a hint of malts to make it taste like beer. Plenty of hops: orange rind, grapefruit, some fruit juice. This is really out of balance in the way that hops win 5-0 against malts in it. Somewhat acidic but not sour (again, must be the hops with no malts to mask). Dry finish.
Palate: very thin. If this could be made a bit thicker without being sweeter it would come across a more alcoholic beer. Hardly surprising giving the 0.5% abv. Carbonation is fairly high. 
Overall: as far as alcohol free beers go, this is probably the best one around. Its pleasant to drink and hoppy, but could do with a bit more body. Its nearly "carbonated hop juice".

Bottle 0.33l from Albert Heijn supermarket Amstedam, The Netherlands. 12.01.2017. Pour it clear orange color with medium white head. Aroma tangerine, pineapple, malt. Taste lots of grainy feel, some tangerine, grassy pretty much, herbal ice tea, after taste grassy as well, ok decent for low alcohol beer, light body, average carbonation, slick feel.

Bottle at home. Pours clear copper with coarse cream head. Malty and aromatic hoppiness at the nose, caramel, red orange, pink grapefruit, grass. Light taste with remarkable but smooth hoppy bitterness. Very quenching alcohol free drink.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2017 330ml bottle purchased at Drinks of the World Lucerne. Pours an amber copper color forming a medium white head with medium to low retention and practically no lacings left in the glass. Nose is great. Very sweet, fruity and hoppy. Pine, pineapple, passion fruit, mango and herbs together with citrus. Taste is biscuity, herby and quite dry. Notes of caramel malts and hops. Good bitterness. Body is very light and watery as expected from the style. Herby and piney aftertaste. Good drinkability. Tastes like a very dry and light Pale Ale. Great option to alcohol free (and low alcohol) lovers.

Bottled, 330ml from Marks & Spencers in Banbury, Oxon. Amber with white head. This proved to be pretty thin on the palate, caramel is the predominant flavour unfortunately, sweet maltiness. Edging on disaster area.

Kolor bursztynowy, piana średnia. W aromacie amerykańskie chmiele oraz mocny zapach brzeczki piwnej. W smaku piwo jest jednak puste, wodniste mocno wytrawne. Czuć dość mocną goryczkę; w posmaku też pustka. Nic ciekawego
butelka. obok west coast ipa to na pewno nie stało, woda chmielowa pachnie bardziej bogato, generalnie strata kasy. nie warto!

Caramel, petite carbo, petit collet et belle dentelle
Aromes bien fruités, resineux
Amertume seche en finale sur des notes fruites et caramel, tres mince.
On sent bien la difference entre 87 kilos et 450 kilos pour 20HL

19.12.2016 - I thought of non fermented malt sweetness and lacking hops but this is the opposite. Great hop aromas fruity, pine and herbs together with citrus. Body is extreme thin and got nothing of that residual sugar sweetness. Feels bit like a carbonised hop tea. Great hop aromas with some notes of malt coming through.

Smell: Perfumey floral nose, reminiscent of soap, slight fruit character, some flat vegetal note.
Taste: Chalky, cardboardy, carbonic, thin, little to no sweetness, lemongrass, vegetal, medium+ bitter piney aftertaste,

For a 0,5abv beer this is almost as good as they come. Although thin and lacking malt character, it has way more hops than most 0abv beers. Quite enjoyable if you dont have more than 1 and can enjoy it for what it is.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Not much to describe. Bland and medicore.

Bottle from Angus & Ale. Pours clear amber brown with next to no head. Weak, next to nothing aroma of citrus juice. Malty light flavour with lemon zest, brown bread and apple juice. light flavours reflected in the palate with sparkling carbonation. Overall a gentle malty beer. Incredibly easy drinking, as you may expect but a bit washy on the whole.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
0.33l bottle. Amber color with high white head. Aroma: citrus, resins, lemonade, yeast. Taste: malt, bread, fruity hoppy. Light body, Lively carbonated. High bitterness with dry hoppy finish.

Taste: resin, citrus, herbs, tannic ; Appearance: pale, golden, hazy, minimal head ; Taste: very bitter, medium sourness ; Palate: very light body, thin feel (almost watery), average carbonation, not very long finish (which is good, here). Overall this tastes like a very bitter herbal tea made with too much different hops varieties, and too little body. I might seem harsh on it, because I very much like the initiative, but when it is a fail, it is a fail...

Acheter à dranken geers à oost staker ( gent ). 
Bouteille de 33 cl. 
Couleur brune foncée avec quelque reflet blond. 
Au nez cest houblonné ( américain ?)
En bouche , on a que le houblon , très houblonné mais parallèlement au faite quelle est peu alcoolisées. Ceci cache des lacune je trouve. 
Manque beaucoup de choses à cette bière pour être apprécié malgré le peu dalcool. 
Dommage

330 ml bottle.

Clear brown color with off white head and long lasting lacing. Bitter and hoppy taste. Slightly watery but good for low alcohol.
Bottle. Has aroma of american hops and there is nice medium bitterness. But generally is more like water than beer

A few bottles at home over the course of the past few sober weeks. Its the best Nealko that Ive ever tried. Pours Amber with a White head. The aroma bursts out of the bottle and allows you to suspend for a moment the belief that youre drinking a Nealko. When you sup it, its clear that the alcohol is absent. Its thin. Like a hop tea. Very flavoursome and with a pronounced bitterness. Its not in any way a chore to drink this beer. Impressive.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra Gorinchem
Hazy golden with an off-white head. Good strong hop aroma. First taste is promising: decent hopbitterness with some malts. but its gone before you know it due to the minimal malts content in the beer. Still. its decent to good for what it is: a decently hopped malt beer.
Clear golden liquid, average head. Strong aroma of hops. Light body, strong carbonation. Taste is bitter.
Of course, something is missing, but very good for what it is. Especially great arima. Just a bit flat.

Belle robe ambrée claire, mousse blanche moyenne. Nez caramel, orange, pamplemousse, fruits de la passion. En bouche, on discerne le manque de matière et on a un corps très aqueux, une bonne amertume et la présence marquée des agrumes. Très bonne ... pour une bonne sans alcool !

Bottle. Dark orange body, good beige head with decent retention. Aroma of orange candies and grapefruit, caramel and hints of pine. Taste of mineral water, caramel, grapefruit zest, metallic notes. A tad flat. Probably the best NA beer Ive tried so far.
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy dark amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, watery and a mild bitterness.

Piwo klarowne w kolorze ciemno miedzianym z dosc obfita grubopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie na poczatku bardzo intensywnie od chmieli, sa grejpfruty, cytrusy, ananas i mango. W smaku rowniez wszystko pasuje, jest zywica, trawa cytrynowa i slody. Z czasem piwo jednak bardzo szybko sie wygazowuje, caly czar pryska i zostaje slodko gorzka woda. Ciezko dopic bez zmeczenia sie.

Kolor miedziano br?zowy, klarowny. Piana wysoka, sztywna cho? z uwagi na budow? do naj?adniejszych nienale?y, Sporych rozmiarów oczka p?kaj?c tworz? co? na wzór piany po detergencie.

Une bière sans alcool qui ne ressemble pas à une sans alcool. Du caractère, vraiment intéressante

Bottle
Clear brown, white thick head.
Aroma of caramel, 
Taste bitter and thin. Fizzy.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2016 Bottle @ DogTap Ellon. Being the designated driver, this beer is awesome. A low-alcohol beer with aroma and taste! Compared to low-alcohol lagers, this is outstanding. Plenty of malts and hops and not watery. There is a slightly sour note in the taste, otherwise this would have been a top-scorer.

Vlear, dark brown colour and a frothy, tan head. Hoppy aroma, sweet bubblegum, some fruit. Somewhat bitter taste, dry finish, a bit soapy, hoppy aftertaste. Medium (on the lower end) body, light carbonation. Its pretty good for such a low alcohol beer.
Brown color with an off-white head, good retention. Aroma is hoppy with light toasted malts. Flavor is medium bittery, light toasted. Watery final. Not bad for a non alcohol beer
Ampolla de Vins J. Carreras. Cervesa amb aromes clars de llúpol però equilibrada. Bona.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2016 Clear amber. A: carrot juice, medium exotic fruits, sweet malts. T: follows aroma, sweet maltiness is more pronounced. Lacks punch wrt mouthfeel because of low abv. Quite bitter in development and finish.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 The best low alcohol beer I have had. 
Dark amber color with big neck. Hoppy malty hay smell. Taste is fresh bitter hops with long bitter after taste. Ultra-enjoyable low alcohol IPA! Going to have a lot of sessions with it! Such a great alternative to the low alcohol lagers out there.

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown with a tiny off white head that fades. Little carbonation. Aroma is strong and bitter, some caramel hints. The taste is watery and very bitter. Dry hops all the way, even stronger in the aftertaste.

This is with out a doubt the best low alcohol beer I have tasted. Pours deep golden brown from the bottle has a very distinct hoppy flavour you would expect and a hint of caramel. Top beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear amber colour with medium white head. Aroma is hoppy tropical fruits with caramel touch. In taste there is some hops, light bitterness. Palate- medium carbonation and watery thin body. Most surprising- caramel in colour, caramel in aroma, none of it in taste. Fairly drinkable. 
I had 1 na 100 by Kormoran for comparison (1% ABV Rye little APA) and it beats Nanny State to death with taste, body and aroma (and less than half the price in there)

09/07/2016 - sip from a 33cl bottle offered by a friend who cant drink alcohol.
Amber coloured with big head. Nose is insane exotic fruits. Taste is very bitter with hints of fruits, a bit soapy,very long bitter aftertaste. Way too bitter but very affordable as a low alcoholic beer.
Clear amber liquid with yellowish head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits. Medium bitter. Good juicy low alc
Bottle from a tap takeover swag bag. Deep amber pour. Big grapefruit and tropical aroma. Flavour is very light. By far the best alcohol-free beer Ive ever had.
Rated as low-alcohol. Great taste and aroma characteristic for hoppy beers, maybe too much watery, but this is the only flaw.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wine; dark copper pour with a bubbly off white head, aroma has some pine hop and light malt, taste has watery malts, some caramel, light pine hop, bitter finish, well crafted for a LA.

I bought this beer at the.drink of the worldmin Geneva and.I drank it in Paris. For a beer without alcohol, it is decent one, we could say an I.P.A without alcohol. The body is copper and regular carbonation, thin foam. The taste is refreshing, hop giving a perfect bitter note, citrus, watery.

How successful this beer is depends on your point of reference. Compared to standard ales, it might not stack up too well, but compared to any other alcohol free beer its a revelation. It actually tastes like beer! Hoppy, citric, a little floral, robust hoppy bitter finish. OK, so it lacks body and depth, but this is definitely a step in the right direction for alcohol free beers.

330ml bottle (thanks Elvira). Dark amber color. Small size, off-white head, stays. Fruity, citrus, tropical fruits in aroma. Citrus, fruity and very watery in aftertaste. Very watery mouthfeel. Its something.

Flaske 0,33L fra Extra i Hamna. Klar mørk brun litt rødlig med lyst beige skum. Malt, humle, mildt lett bitterhet. Fin fylde til alkoholfritt. En god øl
5.4.5.3.10
Bottle shared by Elvira. This is hop water with the usual BD citric and resiny hop profile, but without any malt to balance it, so its kinda sharp.
Bottle (thanks elvira). Pours copper. Aroma is copper. Aroma is grassy, herbal, onions. Flavor is hoppy, bitter, watery, onions. Overall: not good.
Smakrik alkoholfri öl. Stor bitterhet från humlen, men också lite brödig maltighet. Helt ok.

330ml bottle. Clear but quite a dark amber/copper colour with a small one finger head. Aroma is really hoppy, lots of citrus. Taste also really hoppy and citrusy, some malt undertones but the hops dominate. Bitter finish. Carbonation is soft and by the time Id finished this it was almost completely gone, leaving it very watery. Aside from that I thought this was actually really good for a low alcohol beer, if you have to avoid alcohol for any reason and still want to drink, this would probably be a good choice.

Bottle from local shop. Pours surprisingly dark beer with a white head. Aroma is hoppy and has much citrus on it. Taste is surprisingly good as low alcohol beer, but of course watery. Good choice for someone who is avoiding alcohol, has to drive, etc.

Pint at Brewdog Clapham Junction. The first beer I had was an exclusive and apparently not on Ratebeer yet so my first ever review is of a 0.5%er!

Thought Id give it a go becaus I like a mild. However its your basic low ABV beer with a slightly darker taste. However still tastes and smells of little. Like a beery cola and gassy to boot. I was in a hurry so didnt finish the whole pint.
Nice and refreshing IPA with plenty of citrus and hops aroma and taste. Good on a hot summer day or if one has to drive.

Clear and ritch amber color with thick caramel foam. Aromas of hops, tea leaves, herbal oils, soily and marynka dried hops whilst still in a bag. Palate, medium/light body with thin texture leaving bitter finsihs. Taste is a big surprise! Bitter of coffee and hops and maybe strong hop tea? but thats about it? Overall, wow! Something unexpected! Has nice IPA like aromas and appearance, but tastes quit flat and hoppy but bitter, in a wayd does remind of hop tea that has too much hops in it. Interesting and good for low alcohol.
Bottle. Pours clear chestnut - mahogany with frothy head. Aroma is grassy hops, ashy, some fruits. Flavour is malty, hoppy, some butter, tea. Starts quite watery and ends malty and hoppy.
On tap better than most non-alc beers Ive tried (although I havent tried many craft ones). Lemony aroma with some metallic herby hops as you drink it. Nice lacing and dark enough color.

0.33 l bottle from local AH, best before March 2017. Clear, mahogany with a thin, fluffy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Sweetish, fruity-resiny and rather soapy taste of orange jam, pine, lychee and lime. Slightly bitter, fruity-resiny and a bit soapy, but overall also very faint and watery taste of caramel, orange jam, pine and some citrus, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly resiny finish. Thin body, very watery mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. I think this is pretty awful, like bitter water. Have had a lot of better alcohol-free beers, not only Kehrwieders ü.NN. Would prefer almost every sweetened macro-Radler over this. Did not expect that at all.

Clear tan color. Fruity, tropical hop aroma, hint of caramel. Not much else. Tastes like a hop spritzer. No sweetness at all, very bitter, but surprisingly flavorful for a n/a beer. For when you want some hoppy goodness without the booze. Not bad.

33 cl bottle. Clear golden red-brown, white foamy head, low carbonation. Aroma is hoppy, as expected. Mouthfeel is watery with a dry finish, well carbonated and bitter. Taste is pleasantly filled with hops and some specialty grain flavours. This is the best Low Alcohol beverage Ive tasted so far. Great for the hop heads among us, in situations where we cant drink the real McCoy.

Pourquoi pas. Nez entre litchi, agrumes.
Du houblon. très aqueuse. Légèrement malté. Finale très chlorophyllienne, un peu dérangeant.

Riecht wahnsinnig abgefahren. Bei den verwendeten Hopfen nicht verwunderlich, aber immerhin sprechen wir über ein Alkoholfreies. Optisch solide und auch der Trunk mit seinen 45 IBUs nicht von schlechten Eltern. Irgendwie fehlt natürlich schon was, daher ist der Nachhall auch etwas schwachbrüstig. Insgesamt aber eine mehr als gelungene Alternative zum Softdrink. Kleine Flasche im GALOPPER DER JAHRES HH für 5,50 Euro. Bier 6/7
Cerveza sin alcohol. Muy buen sabor a lúpulo, aunque se queda un poco corto. Recuerda a una IPA. Como cerveza sin alcohol está muy bien.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 After that infamous battle about making the strongest beer in the world, our friends of BrewDog apparently took it the other way and produced this hypo-alcoholic ISA. Pours a weird brownish, mahogany-hued copper colour, clear with no visible sparkling at all, under a thick, moussy, off-white, dense but slowly breaking head. Aroma of juniper berries, spruce shoots, dried grapefruit peel, some dried tomato, roasted peanuts, rainwater, caramel, raw spinach, dried mediterranean herbs. Clean, fairly neutral onset, dominated by some kind of basic sourishness with way too low - if any at all - sweet fruitiness for balance, soft carbo, thin and watery mouthfeel as can be expected from a beer of this ABV, nutty and toasted malts but in a watery environment, dryish finish with some retronasal dried grapefruit peel tendencies as well as a weak, watered-down peppery hops hint. Obviously a beer of this weakness will never produce a malt body thick and solid enough to counter for this amount of hops: this is an understatement of a session IPA, rich enough in terms of aroma alone, but somehow the complete lack of (malty) body makes this taste like (lightly) sparkling water hopped with some overly fragrant American piney hop variety. The hops dominate against almost nothing - needless to say, this table beer is completely out of balance. My guess is that this would have been a lot better if the hop dosis would have been toned down a bit - agreed it would have been a lot more boring, but at least I would not have been left with the feeling I just drank heavily American hopped water... Good for the tick but this irritates me probably more than anything else I ever had from this hyped brewery - move on to the next.

Bottled from local grocery store. Copper colored, dying head. Beautiful hoppy nose, flowery. Very watery flavor, hardly any hops there, extremely thin mouthfeel. Great smell, but apart from that pretty awful.

Bottle from Tesco, Skipton. Copper coloured with an amber glow. It has a wonderful hoppy tropical fruit nose, but the lack of alcohol is more than evident in its weak taste. There are a few hops here though.

33c bottle. Dark amber pour with an almost non-existent tan head. Smells of pine and citrus hops. The taste is very bitter, with notes of grapefruit, orange zest and pine resin and no kind of malty sweetness whatsoever. A very harsh bitter aftertaste, but even so, the best non-alcoholic beer I have tasted, to date.

12oz bottle from Tesco. Pours light golden brown with a light beige head. Aroma is citrus hop, mostly grapefruit. Taste is watery with a touch of biscuit and grapefruit hop bitterness. Its not amazing, but really remarkable for 0.5%. Would drink again. So chuggable!

Dark amber, perfectly clear with nice head. Aroma: citrousy, quite intense but quickly disappearing. Taste: water with hoppy bitterness. There is no sweetness, bitterness is high. Unbalanced and tiresome.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours amber with one-finger thick beige head. Aroma is crisp and sharp. Hops, caramel malts, citrus, grapes and zest in the nose. Flavour is way thinner. Sadly. Bitterness and a little citrus and grapes, ends dry and metallic. Thin-medium body and average carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 17/09/16. na szybko: przejrzyste, jasnozlote piwo z niezla piana, zostajaca na szkle. aromaty tez ok, choc niezbyt intensywne - zywice, trawa, cytrusy. w ustach niestety gorzej - nijakie nieco, z niezbyt sympatyczna goryczka, slodkawe, lagerowe. wiec chyba sukces, bo sumarycznie jest jak takie sobie piwo craftowe, a nie jak bezalkoholowe :)Rami Rami is drinking a Nanny State by BrewDog at BrewDog WarszawaJakby z brzoskwiniowa herbata... Inaczej pamietam srednia ocen :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle - clear fizzy amber brown. Large off white head. Hoppy floral aroma, bit of a ting on the tongue and in mouth. Lacking a bit of depth in taste, but ok for low Alcohol.

At Bar Maquilla, with stew of ox with imperial stout and rice with duck. Lunch with the family. Very good in aroma, creating a great expectation. However, the taste isnt as good, a bit muted compared with the superb nose.

Pours deep caramel/amber with a lively cream head which fizzes away. Aroma is grassy, earthy and sprucey. Taste is grassy, earthy, slight citrus bitterness. Medium-high bitterness. Pretty hoppy for a low-alco.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear amber with a medium sized white head, some lacing. Hoppy nose, citrus zest, grapefruit and pineapple. Light and thin but still not too bad for a low abv, dry and crisp. The taste is thinner than the aroma, floral bitterness, citrus and a some unclean bitterness in the finish with metallic notes.

Ambrata limpida con riflessi dorati, schiuma beige non molto persistente.
Aroma di pompelmo e passion fruit.
Al palato leggero pompelmo ed una coda estremamente amara, anche troppo, che ricorda il legno e la camomilla.
Ovviamente priva di corpo ma ben carbonata.

Bottle. Pours a clear deep amber colour with a fizzy off white head. Aroma of bready malts, some caramel, slight melon, a little orange, pine and subtle herbal hops. Taste of bready malts, some caramel, slight orange, a little melon, subtle pine, a hint of wood and herbal hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A short, dry, herbal hop bitterness in the finish. Its not watery like you would expect. Good bitterness and subtle sweetness. Would never guess it only contains 0.5 alcohol.
La mejor cerveza sin alcohol que he probado sin duda. Con cuerpo, matices herbáceos sobre fondo tostado... una gozada para los que no pueden beber alcohol.

Pours copper t brown with a thin off-white head.

Aroma is reasonably hoppy mix of mango, caramel, tangerine, orange peel and mint. Some bitterness and sweetness with a lingering thin finish. 

It may be thin but its very decent low alcohol beer - just try the competition!
Barwa bursztynowa, piana ładna trwała. Aromat chmielowy, niedojrzałe cytrusy i tytoń. W smaku bardzo wodniste, wyraźną, tytoniową goryczką.

Cervesa correcta, tenint en compte que només té mig grau està força bé.
Cerveza correcta, teniendo en cuenta que solo tiene medio grado esta bastante bien.
Sad to notice that alcohol brings the body to the beer. This is basically hop water. Pretty nice aromas and all, but taste is just meh. Worth of trying though.
Golden color with medium white head. Hoppy aroma. Taste is watery with hops bite.No body. Basically this is just water with hoppy taste.

For me, this is way, way the best non-alcoholic beer I have ever tasted. The only thing that lets it down is the initial aroma, which I find more mango than hops. Apart from that, it beats many alcoholic beers and its a wonderful pint. I absolutely congratulate Brewdog.

Bottle 330 ml from Amstein - St-Légier (CH). Dark amber with a short foam holding badly. Malted aromas, compote, varnish-pine, solvent, citrus. The mouth is fresh and bitter, dry, notes of biscuit, no sweetness, everything is based on bitter and light. Herbs-citrus-pine-medicine. Wont let me an unforgettable memory !
This is far better than some alcholic IPAs that Ive drank. Super hoppy, wonderfully refreshing. Just amazing.

(bottle) slightly hazy deep amber colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of mango, passion fruit and brown sugar, with big notes of caramel, some prickly pear, burnt toffee and honeymelon. flavour is mostly buttered crumpets and raisins, with a light hint of cherries, some treebark, grass and a light-bitter finish. very light-bodied with average carbonation.
Thuis. Hoppige dorstlesser! Ja het is waterig, ja de smaak is dun... Maar ook ja het is lekkerder dan elk alcoholvrij/arm bier dat ik ken.. Backlog from 2015/07/09.
Bottle from Tesco. Im shocked because it actually tastes like beer, albeit somewhat watered down. Easily the best alcohol free (ish) beer Ive had.

Bottle bbe 26.08.26. Nice fruity and caramelly aroma. Taste is water with hoppy bitterness, no body at all, long bitter finish. For 0,5% abv this is quite good but the missing body doesnt make you wanna drink one after another.

Bier überrascht mit einer kastanienbraunen Farbe und schönen Schaum, toller blumig fruchtiger Geruch, im Geschmack relativ wässrig aber durchaus auch schöne fruchtige Hopfen im Abgang erstaunlich herb, das beste alkoholfrei das ich bisher hatte

Aroma: intense floral hops, some straw, grain malts. Appearance: clear, dark brown, medium, creamy, off-white head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: watery, floral hops, grapefruit, bitters continue and turn quite violent in the finish. Overall: I guess decent for a low alcohol beer, yet a touch too bitter given its also quite watery. Bottle from Tesco, Pimlico.

Chestnut coloured, clear, medium, slightly tanned and coarse head.
Aroma: tropical fruits, fresh hops, a hint of caramel.
Taste: Strong bitterness but watery at first. Then a bit malty. Bitter finish but thin body. 
Not as bitter as expected with 200+ IBU.
Mango and kiwi aroma and taste watery body dissipating head rubbish as a beer decent as a low abv

0.5%abv. Purchased in Tesco St.Enoch. Nice aroma; citrus and caramel. Appearance is dark amber, lack of head. Taste is fairly boring because of the 0.5%abv, very waterish. Thin carbonation, plain palate and abrupt finish.
To me this brew was like huge hops punch on water backbone. Unbalanced in terms of lack of sweetness, so hoppiness seems naked, grassy.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015  Appearance  Pours a clear copper, with a thin white head, like when you pour a soda. 
Aroma The aroma is that of an over-hopped IPA - grass and and citrus, no malt flavours are present.
Taste The taste is vile; no sweetness at all, just a harsh bitterness The taste is about as balanced as a psychotic schizophrenic on crack.
Palate The mouthfeel is thin, much like carbonated mineral water.
Overall Obviously, Brew Dog must have no idea how to brew beer, if they think they can counter less malt and a lower gravity by adding more hops.

Super Alkoholfreies! (0,5%)
Schmeckt deutlich besser als manche IPAs obwohl es ein Pale Ale ist. Ganz leicht malzig, toll hopfig, perfekt als isotonische Erfrischung nach dem Sport.
Schön herb und süß im Abgang.
Cooles Gebräu!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nieporozumienie. Piwo prawie bezalkoholowe, które zachęca aromatem amerykańskich chmieli, o wiele lepszym, niż większość lagerów. Jednakże jest to zwodnicze, ponieważ w smaku jest kompletnie bezpłciowe, bezsmakowe i wybitnie wodniste. Najsłabszy projekt Brewdoga, jaki miałem przyjemność (tu czyt. nieprzyjemność pić). Klapa totalna. Omijać z daleka.
Its a pretty decent low alcohol ale with a nice certain bitterness. However I truly miss the alcohol.

On tap, BrewDog Bar Brussels. Pours in dark amber body with low white head. Aroma is malty with light caramel. Taste has high earthy grassy bitterness with medium caramel sweetness. Flat body, little bit watery.

Bottled 330ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb. Dark golden coloured, small to medium sized off-white head, citrusy nose. Sweetish malty, citrusy hoppy, weak notes of caramel and bitter hoppy finish. Not bad at all for n/a beer.
Bottle @ home. Aroma of pine and citrus hops. Brown amber colour, off-white head, lasting. Taste is moderate bitter, very thin. Watery, light body, average carb., bitter short finish.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 11/06/16 Pours clear amber to light brown 
liquid, medium frothy tan head, Aroma: heavily hopped, citrus, orange, lemon, lemon grass, resin, Taste: light sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, caramel, citrus, lemon grass, resin, watery, Palate: light watery body, slick texture, average carbonation, long citrus resin finish, Overall: not so bad, appearance and aroma is fine, the taste is at the beginning ok, than you realize the watery profile. For a nonalcoholic beer pretty good, otherwise not so.

15cl sample at the Ghent Beer Festival VI (22 VIII 2015). Bright amber, orange beer with a massive, hoppy nose. Almost unbelievable. Make this a low alcohol IPA. These fruity aromas are quite surprising and promising. Yet, the taste does not meet up with the great expectations. This is beer for diabetics, to state it bold, with no sweetness at all. Even worse: I cant even notice clear malts or grains. A pitty. This does not really taste like beer and the watery notes are too present.
Quite surprised this is a low alcohol beer, will get more! Hopy aroma and quite nice bitter taste, it tastes like an IPA all over. Great discovery at ABC Beer shop. (Velp 201508)
Average off-white head with low retention. Reddish amber colour. Aroma is hoppy, floral and citrus. Taste is bitter and dry. Watery palate and light body. Good to be alcohol free.

Backlog from old tastenotes: Aroma is very fruity and hoppy. Taste is low malt with some citrus and grapefruit hoppiness, but it gets kind of "hollow". I guess this is the best you can do at this abv-rate? Nothing I would buy again, but if Im somewhere and really need to drive or something, I would grab one without hesitation.

Taste this as the first beer on sat. 22.08.15 from bottle 33 cl. @ 6edition of Gents Bier Festival. Almost clear amber-orange color, with white head. 
Aroma: nice exotic fruits (mango, peach..) from hops. Light tot medium body.
Taste: softsweet, very fruits, good hoppy and bitter. Long bitter finish. Surprise what a taste for the low alcohol style.

At 0.5% ABV youve got to have pretty realistic expectations re taste. And theyre easily met. Yes, its light and watery and notably lacking sweetness and thickness from the malt. But its get a great nose - plenty of exotic fruit and citrus. Im a big fan. for those times when you feel like a beer to quench the thirst but don;t need the alcohol.

Optisch alles dufte, rötlich braun, leichte, stabile Schaumkrone und tolle Perligkeit. Im Näschen Grapefruit - im Trunk sehr bitter, Frucht kommt zwar durch, dann aber nochmal bitter. Abgang wie bei viel Alkoholfreien kaum vorhanden. Schade schade, da ist Dead Pony die bessere Wahl.
33cl bottle from cerveteca lisboa, portugal. Color is brown, dark copper. Head is persistent and thin. Taste is light sweet, light bitter. Flavour is piney, hops, malt and water.
Pours clear amber with a beige head. Nice fruity, citrus, hoppy aroma. Flavor is...ohhh! Malty, sweet and bitter, dry. Quite undrinkable.
Excellent low alcohol beer. Great fruity taste, honey palate. Your daily brew.
Bottle shared. Pours clear amber. Hops, pine nose. Flavour is sweet honey. Very light watery body, tastes like weak tea. Thats done for that style.

Aroma: High hops! High Piney, resiny, Medium minty.
Appearance: Brilliant amber body. Small, tan head. Good retention, lacing.
Flavour: High bitterness, medium-high hops, resiny, spruce, almost herbal medicine-like. Dry finish, lingering spruce.
Mouthfeel: Light body. Medium carbonation, creamy.
Overall: A great idea, but it tastes like you are licking a pine tree! Needs balancing.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Llew!
14B. American IPA

330ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark amber copper color with big off white head. Heavy hoppy aroma, piney, grass, fruity, light caramel malty. Sweet and bitter taste. Light to medium almost oil body with soft carbonation. Very good for a 0.5% alc beer!
Keg at BD Brizzle. Pours bronze with thin head. Smells biscuity with some watery hops, tastes watered down dead pony. Its got some flavour with its 0.5% but I really wouldnt bother again

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear deep amber color with medium creamy off-white head, poor lacing and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of passion fruit, peach, some citrus and mild caramel. Taste starts light sweet malty and woody, follows mild fruity with dry mouthfeel and moderate bitter finish. Light body, watery texture and average carbonation in palate. Finally, well done low alco brew...

Burnt copper, thin swift head and soft lacing. Nose is cheap orange peel, coins and a raise of maltiness. Initial taste is lean bitter and slip of sweetness, flavours are a bit of a squeeze though. Tinny, brown lemonade lemony and a rising bitterness. Firm carbonation and mouthfeel doesnt fall too flat. Finishes long prod of a dirty keyhole, malty and neatly hoppy. Linger is much the same, bit woody. All in for the ABV this is pretty solid. Freshness matters and I had a bottle from my fridge the same date on the same night as one from the top shelf in Tesco and they were worlds apart where it matters. Also, had it in keg at The Anderson and it was tremendous.
0.33 bottle at Cameral, Koper. Coca-Cola color, small off white head. Wood and caramel, mixed with hop aromas. Carbonated, woody, bitter. Like dry hopped water, which is not necessarily bad.
Quite good aromawise to only contain 0,5% ABV. This and Johnny Low by Lervig are both good alternatives when you want something hoppy, but have to drive afterwards. Floral, sitrus, grapefruit.

Amber, almost brown clear colour with creamy white head. Aroma of (tropical) fruits, the same is taste, but is somehow empty finish. Malt sweetness is low, hop bitterness is medium. Proper beer for nonalcoholic

Surprisingly "beery" for 0.5 ABV. Nice body. Lovely maltiness.. dunno how its even possible :D caramel, nice hops, some grapefruit. Mostly sweet with light bitterness. Woldnt buy it, but as beer experience was quite nice.
So if I should drive, this would be wuite ok choice

Pours medium brown with a head that doesnt hang about long. Fruity and hoppy on the nose. To taste its bitter hops with a fruity and citrus phase. For an alcohol free beer it does the trick, decent enough for tje designated driver
Draft. From notes. Clear golden amber color, white coca cola head. Nice grapefruit and lemon aroma. Taste is bright bitter citrus. One of the better NA beers Ive tried.

Clear brown beer with a good white head.
Taste is watery, caramel, lemon, bitter hop flavor, grapefruit.
Truly indicate a BrewDog beer, but without alcohol.
Unfortunately, like all 0% alcohol beers, not tasty.

Brown bottle, 330ml, co-op. Pours dark caramel, transparent, with a medium white head subsiding at an average pace. Scent is light grass and lemon notes. Taste is harsh earthy, grassy, grainy texture with little sweetness. Mouthfeel is light, carbonated, yeasty, and bitter. Finish is dry and meaty. Not a fan.
Bottle. Middle sized, tanned head. Chrystal clear dark copper. Nice hoppy aroma. Dark malty taste, molasses, tight grapefruit.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

The aroma is pleasant, with i/ light and floral hop. In the mouth however it is hollow. Too bitter for its body with a tobacco malt character. Plenty of caramel too. For a NA sure whatever, but I dont like it.
Aroma: tropical fruits, resin, citrusTaste: medium bitter, spruce, resin, citrusLack of body, but it?s still good for a non alcoholic beer
Mahogany colour with full head. Citrus, grape and peppery aroma. Hops also there in the tast. Lacking body.

33cl bottle served in a Struise glass. Pours amber colour with a nice white head. Aroma is surprisingly clean and grassy hops. Mouthfeel is massively thin and watery and the initial hoppiness gives way to an almost effervescent paracetemol bitterness. Such a disappointment following Mikkellers drinkin the sun (admittedly on draft) which in no way indicated its (almost) non-existent ABV. Very disappointing.

Bottle from Archive Beer Boutique West End 080615. Dark copper colour with a big loose head that slowly settles. Thin bodied with a strange flavour but you expect it to taste a bit different given that it has no alcohol. Good beer when you have to drive.

Bootle from Humulus et Fermentum, Heisdorf. Pours clear amber brown with white head that dissipates quickly. Nose is fruity, mango, grapefruit, peach. Taste is pleasantly hoppy and bitter, also a bit nutty, with long finish. Mouthfeel is a bit thin. Very good for the style.

A bit hazy brown color, small to medium sized white head. Extremely nice hoppy aroma. No wonder, knowing the list of hops used to make this brew. Well, taste is the problem. Surprisingly, its not extreme vegetables. But it is extremely watery. Like water with mint. And I dont like mint. In fact, its so watery that reminded me of some very watery mint green tea. And some hip. Again, hip tea. Some bitterness in the finish. I dont know, I guess I could give it a passable rating. (Pivoljub 0,33 bottle)

Bottle at home. This beer is clear and has a dark amber color, and some beige foam. The aroma is filled with fruity hops, grapefruit, pine needles and rye. The taste has more rye bread, burnt malt and nuts, and something strange bitterness in the end. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and has a sharp bitterness. Its aroma is gentle, and the taste is unbalanced with roasted tones. Has a lot of bitterness in the end.
For a 0.5% beer this is pretty tops. Drank the shit out of it on the drive home. Had about 6 more when I got home and didnt feel a thing. Pissed like a truck though
Bottle from supermarket. Deep sold colour fizzy white head. Big hoppy aroma and a very bitter finish. Not get a great depth of flavour or complexity but for a no alcohol beer its great.

Clear deep amber color, thin off white head. Aroma of caramel, citrus, some fruitiness, malt, flowers. Taste of... Well, water. Light touch of caramel, citrus, grass and tea. Light body, soft to average carbonation. Not good.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle. Brown body with tan head. Aroma is fruity with citrus and pines. Taste is thin with some malts and hints of caramel and water. Aftertaste is bitter with hints of malts. Best alcohol free I ever had.

330ml bottle. Pours amber with bubbly off-white head. Aroma is light citrus. Taste is rather light and airy citrus with a bitter finish. Obviously not going to be a hop-bomb. But for what it is, its alright.
Well what do you expect? Its never going to be amazing but for a driving option its pretty damn good.
not a fan, i dont taste anything about hops and something that remind me mineral water. Its ok, i think, for the style.

On tap at Brewdog Birmingham, pours a clear copper with a small white head. Nose brings out light biscuity notes with only a touch of hops. Flavour is quite rancid really, with metallic notes and biscuity malt, with a harsh astringency on the finish. Why would you ever drink this? Quite gross really. Drain pour.
Golden copper. Almost no head. watery body but fair amount of hops. There is an aftertaste of cardboard that i dont like. Overall it is a good performance for a hoppy low alcohol beer.

Bottle at home. Looks like coke when poured, thin white head. The aroma is very hoppy. Lots of pine, like floor cleaner. The taste is pretty bad, some malt and then a rasping, harsh bitterness that makes the throat contract. Thin palate and little carbonation. Overall - undrinkable. If you need an alcohol-free drink, try coffee. Or fruit juice, water, anything but this.
Pours a nice copper with a thick foamy head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is tropical fruits. Very watery palate, vit of a bitter taste with not much pay off.

Bottle from Tesco. Brewdog have done a fine job with this. The usual problems with low/non-alcohol beer still exist here, but Nanny State provides just enough flavour to make it a worthwhile choice if you find yourself unable to have a "proper" drink. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to bobinlondon for the bottle, cheers! Pours a clear dark amber color with a team head. The smell is citrus, grapefruit and pine. The taste is dull mnakr with citrus, bitterness and dryness following. Very light body with fairly active carbonation. Pretty good for .05% but it smells better than it tastes.
nice light fruit hoppy aroma,golden, clear, off White,very bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Amber coloured and clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Heavy hoppy aroma, tropical fruits. Flavor is mainly bitter, a bit too bitter without the malts.

Bottle at home. Pours a dark amber brown with an off white head. Aroma is caramel, light veg, pine, lemon... Light body, medium carbonation. Not surprisingly, its thin, but theres pleasant floral, herby, piney, lemon flavours which are good. Some wood and light caramel too. For a low alcohol beer, its good.

Bottle picked up at De Bierkoning 
Pours clear dark copper with a small beige head, some lacing. Aroma is grassy, fruity and citrus. Thin mouthfeel but it has lots of flavors, fruity, grains and light smokiness 
For what it is, I like this.
330 ml bottle from Tesco. Dark amber colour with lots of bubbles. Very hoppy aroma. Not too sweet for a low alcohol beer. Bitter aftertaste.

24.7.2014. Looks like decent beer with dark copper colour and big head. Aroma is a bit strange. There are malts and hops but sth strange. Same goes for taste. First come malts and some aromatic hops but finish has strange taste. It is unique in its class but I would still rather choose watery non-alcoholic beer. I dont see this drinkable.

Pours pale copper with a small head.
Nose shows sweet malt, bready and toasty notes, spicy and resinous hops.
Flavours include soft sweet malt at first with a hint of roast and some grapefruit/spicy hops.
Watery body as expected.

33cl bottle from Tesco, Camberley. Golden amber, with a loose cream head; richly hopped aroma, some citrus and birch wood; rather thin and watery, but with a good citrusy hop taste; and a rather thin finish. Great hops for a low alcohol beer.
Bärig, lätt blommig och citrusfylld doft. Smaken är ganska intensiv men kroppen är för klen. Eftersmaken ligger dock kvar rätt länge. Toppar klassen, helt klart.

Pours dark brown with a short lived white head. Classic IPA aromas of citrus. Tastes surprisingly good for such a low ABV beer, but is let down by being too watery... nicest low alcohol beer Ive tried though.

330ml bottle from Tesco.
Looks and smells like an IPA and initial taste is hoppy citrus and a bit floral. Not too bad and will come in handy on occasions but let down by being too watery. Decent attempt at a low alcohol ale though.

Bottle, pours woody brown with a white head. Hoppy aroma, tangerine, weeds, initally relatively full mouthfeel, but very quickly turns very watery. Excellent low alcohol beer, but its not the real thing.
Flaska från SB. Mörkt bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Humlig doft med lite bröd och bränt socker. Lätt och torr med liten beska.
Light ruby colour, beige head. Aroma of hops, caramel. Taste is light bitter. Thin watery texture, light body, average to fizzy carbonation. Very good for a low alcohol beer.

Flaska systembolaget. Bärnstensfärgad åt det mörkare hållet med smutsvitt skum. Hulmefrisk doft som drar åt citrus och framförallt barr. Kavring. Smaken domineras av en kraftig beska men lite barr och citrus slår igenom.
How : bottle Appearance : amber, small off - white head. Aroma : grapefruit, caramel, tropical fruits. Palate : thin body, medium to low carbonation.

0,33l bottle. 2015. Dark, amber, off-white head. Lovely fresh hoppy aroma. Might this be the first non-alcoholic beer that really kicks ass? The aroma alone is superb, or is it just that Ive been drinking solely non-alcoholic beers so far in 2015? The taste is fresh, hoppy and slightly roasty. Astringent, but watery and slightly sweet to soften the IBUs. Pretty decent.

Clear orange-amber color with medium head, lots of small bubbles on the side of the glass. The fruit and resins of aroma hops are very present in the nose, but theres already a lack of malt body and residual sweetness noticeable. Taste is pure hops, bitter, with a bitter finish and really no malt sweetness at all. Medium carbonation. A nice project for a hop juice :D This would pair up well with some Munster cheese, my dad claims.

Bottle from Tesco. Pours amber with a thin cream head. Theres a promising fruity hop aroma. The taste is bitter and fruity with notes of grapefruit. Its massively lacking in body though. Theres a bit of a tinny finish too.

330ml bottle from a supremarket in Helsinki, clear chestnut brown colour, small mostly lasting frothy head, good lacing. Heavily hoppy aroma of citrus and hints of pine and flowers, plus a hint of malty caramel. Taste is intially fairly nonexistent, turning into a long moderately bitter finish with an astrigent feel. Light body, dry mouthfeel, lively carbonation. A bit off balance as there is a fair bit of hops without much malts to back them up, anyways the most interesting and second tastiest nonalcoholic beer Ive had.

Bottle from Brewdog

On the nose, Citrus, Grapefruit, not too dissimilair to a Punk IPA.
Taste, well it lacks punch. Im getting Citrus and Grapefruit from the hops, slight metallic, but its extremely thin. Its better with alcohol.
Doft av mango, apelsin och gräs. Mkt smak av tall och krispig malt. Även lite grapefrukt. Ganska generös efterbeska för att vara en alkohol- fri öl. Bra öl i lättvikts- klassen.

Poured from bottle, clear pale gold with low white head. Aroma is strong with notes of citrus, flowers and some bread and hay. Taste is strongly bitter with little malt body to balance the bitterness. Leads into a dry bitter finish. A little too light but a great alternative if youre driving!
Bottle from Ales by mail order didnt like this beer at all strong hop on the aroma and quite a malty taste and a bitter finish
Botella de 33 cl, en tienda XXXII. Color ambar. Sabor a cereal, ligeramente a lupulo, suave.

Keg brewdog. Amber to lacy white head. Aroma is good, dry and fruity with orange and grape. Taste is a bit less good, grainy dry, but drinkable, but the lack of alcohol is evident. Tingly carb and medium body.

A deep copper coloured beer with a thick white head. A strong hop aroma on opening the bottle lasts for a long time. Loads of pithy citrus fruit and grassy. Dry and thin mouthfeel. The taste follows on from the aroma. Very strong hop flavour, pithy grapefruit and lime flavours, plus a grassy element. The finish is strong and hoppy but is very thin.

Powerfully hopped ale without a body. This beer is imbalanced, plain bitter. But it proves thats not only the alcohol content that makes a beer too strong. (And that a bit more of alcohol is beneficial for a matching body for that kind of hopocalypse.)
Ok w zapachu chmiele USA i tylko to w smaku chmiele i dosy? fajna goryczka. Nic poza tym. W?a?ciwie to woda z chmielem. Jako nie alko napój calkiem ok wiec dobra nota.
Full copper, small head. Nose is hops with notes of oak, bad scent. Taste is flat with some smoke-oak, bitterness. Just put it in the toilette!

33cl bottle. Poured a clear, bright amber, with a dense off white head. Aroma of grassy hops, biscuit and spruce. Light mouthfeel, with an upfront hop bitterness in the flavour and some brown sugar. Finish is kinda where it lacks the depth of an alcoholic beer; its very light and minerally. However, this is pretty superb for an alcohol free beer.

Bottle from Tesco, Streatham, London - dark amber pour with white head. Aroma and taste is light citrus and malty, sweet caramel malts, light hoppy, impressive amount of taste for such a low abv brew.

Dark orange, almost brown, no head. 
Aroma: malts, mandarin, hops.
Taste: very pleasant mouthfeel, packs quite a pucnh for the ABV. Grass, hops and malts, also some metal. 

This beer deserves much more credit that it gets.

33cl bottle @ home from Csak a Jó Sör, Budapest.
Body is clear, deep amber,
Head is large, rocky, off-white, moslty lasting, excellent lacing.
Nose is light citrus,
Aroma is metallic, light malty, light grapefruit.
Taste is light sweet, medium bitter.
Finish is long lasting light later heavy hoppy bitter.
medium body, thin texture, average carbonation.
Refreshing, easy to drink, interesting, good hoppy beer.

Pours a clear darker amber color, topped with an average off-white head. Citrusy hopps are easily picked up and very pleasant. Body is a little flat, sweet and watery with nice and easy hoppy bitterness going in the aftertaste. Nice and tasty

Keg at BrewDog Birmingham. Amber, slightly hazy. Minimal head but a decent amount of carbonation. Spruce/pine hop aroma with the savoury sweetness of caramel malt. Sharp clean bitter taste. Considering the ABV it has a decent flavour but theres no way it will get away with having a full body. So yes, watery as hell, but overall nd outstanding recipe and the perfect early afternoon bitter.

Bottle. Pour is amber with a foamy head, aroma is fruity, pine, resin. Taste is smoky, pine, bitter, slightly watery, body is thin and carbonation is soft. Not quite sure what to make of this, certainly different

Bottle from Tesco, decided to check it out as I havent done so before and wanted to see if it would be a decent very low alcohol beer. Pours brown looking like a bitter with lightly foamy head. Smell is impressive, citrus, piney, grassy and grapefruit. Taste is rather bitter and no sweetness and very thin and watery. Above average and has its place!!

Bottle, from Tesco. Chestnut brown, thin but sustained off white head and moderate condition. Solid resinous hop nose with hints of citrus, pine and a peppery earthiness, muted caramel in the background. In the mouth it is quite thin and dry with a tinny hop note, there is a slightly musty earthy note and a hint of spiciness, but not enough sweetness to round the body out enough. Finish is briefly dry and hoppy fading away to a low bitterness
Bottle from tesco. Dark copper beer with medium head. Aroma is grapefruit and hoppy. Taste is cereal grain, some hop bitterness and dry malt. Decent enough.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 330ml bottle from Tesco - Deep amber body, thin white head, great clarity. Nose is a proper hopbomb, loads of citrus and pine, quite winter potpourri in the whole. Taste though is a bit thin, slightly bitter, but all in all quite boring. Mind you for a 0.5% ABV? Stunning.

metallic pine cone aroma, drunk straight from the bottle, strong bitterness in the mouth followed by some biscuit then a quick dry finish. not sure what to make of it, is it an excellent alternative to non alcoholic drinking or just somthing to make you want somthing better

My local Tesco doesnt stock Punk IPA but stocks this! Bizarre! Anyway, pours a clear brown/amber colour, almost tea coloured, with a frothy white head. Aroma is very grassy hops, pine and grapefruit. Wasnt sold on the taste of this one. Admirable effort given that theres almost no alcohol there; piney hops, slight grapefruit, and slightly malty back to it, but it just tastes a little bland. Very watery mouthfeel, and decent enough lacing on the glass. Good effort to brew a low alcohol beer with at least SOME taste to it (Becks Blue, Im looking squarely in your direction), but it just seems to fall a bit flat. A shame from an otherwise great brewer.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 Great hop flavour for a non alcoholic beer, you can sense the malts as well. It is quite highly carbonated, but a great example of a beer tasting non alcoholic beer! 
Re rated, this now has a far more citrusy flavour . Carbonation level is still too high

Very fruity and especially grassy hop (pineharshlike) aroma. Looks a bit like tea... Lot of bitter hop flavours, tickles on the tongue. Not much carbonation. Strong bitter and fruity aftertaste and some hints of malts. Due to the hops you dont miss the alcohol!

Bottle - deep red with a light brown head which lasts a while before gradually fading to a ring. Weak lacing. Aroma is loads of orange, lemon and mango with complementary grass and a little coriander seed. Taste is faintly grassy, a little pine - light bitterness. Watery body and medium carbonation. A great smelling beer let down by its taste, which is similar to that of soda water.
Fantastic color and overall apperance for a non alcoholic beer. Fresh hoppy aroma full of citrus, grapefruit, and resin. Taste is resin, caramel, some smoke. Thin body. Overly bitter finish.

330ml bottle at home. Clear amber brown with a full white soapy head. Light body with low to medium carbonation. Very nice bitterness with some sweet tones. Pine, caramel, malts, hops and spices. Didnt quite expect so much taste in a 0,5% alc. brew, great low alcohol brew!

33cl bottle. Hazy reddish light brown colour with a small white head. Pine, fruit and floral aroma. Average carbonation and light to medium body. Taste is medium bitter with some light sweet notes. Overall, it is hard to believe there is almost no alcohol on it. I wish all non alcoholic beers were like this.
copper colour with off white head. aroma is hoppy pines. taste has a bit of sweetness and medium-heavy bitterness. Not watery at all, missing some body that alcohol gives though. Very nice beer.

Aroma: Very nice american hops. Taste: Little bit of fruits. Almost no malty, but really hoppy. Medium, but nice bitterness on aftertaste. Average head, good lacing and average carbonation. Price [Warsaw, Poland] 13PLN.

Clear golden amber color, light lacey white head, hop nose like youre smelling a bag of pellets before brewing, sort of tastes like that too, presumably because theres not really any malt to back em up, crisp bitters, interesting beer, I actually tried brewing something like this a few years ago and was not as success though this has some of the same characteristics that I didnt like ie very thin palate and hop bitters is like drinking cold carbonated hop tea.
with yves at his home dark amber coloured body with an off white head and a spicy hop aroma a spicy bitter hop wattery taste with a bitter finish
Mökillä. Really pleasant low alcohol beer! Body is a bit thin, still well balanced and enjoyably hopped.

Bottle from S-market. Pale with medium head. Fruity and floral aroma. Bitterness. Dry finnish.
Can't believe there's no alcohol.

Grosse amertume qui ne se trouve ni équilibrée par un maltage, ni par un levurage, ni par un taux dalcool conséquent.Amer donc, et aromatique-amer. Lamarillo fait son petit effet, comme à son habitude.

Sans nul doute la meilleure bière sans alcool.Ne faîtes pas trop les difficiles, labstinence a du bon !

Une vraie réussite, dans sa catégorie.

Pours cloudy copper with a frothy, medium-sized white head. The aroma displays the various elements of the hop cavalcade in this beer: it offers plenty of citrus fruitiness and piney notes. Taste is a bit of a let-down considering the impressive aroma. The hops are prominent but the malt background is very thin and the palate watery. Hop bitterness is medium in strength. Some fruitiness and pine appear in the taste but fade away fairly quickly. Very fresh to drink and even interesting at first because of the hoppiness, but in the end too much is missing. Best low alcohol beer I have had, though.
Prominent taste of hops and malt that leaves an earthen taste upon your tongue. A pleasant enough a beer with a rich taste if you like your beer just a little bit bitter.
At my home with wim. Light brown colored beer with large diminishing white head and no carbonation. Hopped floral aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped.

Appearance- pretty clear, bubbles at the bottom of the glass, dark amber, ruby tinge, small fizzy white head. Aroma- malty, hint of milky chocolate, choc covered raisins, fruity, toffee. Taste- a bit chocolatey, hop bitterness, some malt in the background, a bit of dark fruit and bitter orange, medium to thin mouthfeel, short finish which leaves a bit of bitterness. Interesting.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 Clear copper-coloured beer with minimal head that disappears very quickly, giving it a quite unpleasant appearance. Smells fruity. Aromas of fruits and citrus hops are present, but are not that strong and disappear quickly. Fruity nose that is appealing, but which does not come back in its taste. Tastes far from fruity, mainly malty, slightly metalic and very watery. Quite thin, with a light body. Very heavy carbonated. Mildly bitter towards the end and in its aftertaste, which lasts quite long and which gives you lots of evidence of he present hops. Not that bad within its kind. Tastier than most of the low alcoholic beers though (Radler e.g). However, this kind of beer will never be my favorite.
To be a non-alcoholic beer, it is pretty good. But not to be a regular beer.
Bottle 33 cl. Amber color with frothy white brownish head. Notes of bread, caramel, chocolate, floral, citrus. Interesting and very nice beer for a low alcohol one.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker. Amber colour, thin layer of white foam, disappears quickly. Medium carbonation. Very hoppy aroma with notes of grapefruit and caramel. Thin body, watery. Not bad for 0.5% alcohol.

Bottle from K-supermarket at Kamppi, Helsinki ( 4,89 - thefuck?!?) in August 2014. Batch 119. Pours a clear deep amber with an off-white well-retaining head that leaves some good lacing. Nose is at first quite modest. After having it warmed I get... still not much. Its all very vague, with some mild caramelly-fruity-floral tones... Taste is malty with some straightforward hop bitterness coming in right after. I think its just robust and not at all enjoyable. Very thin body with a watery palate, soft carbonation and a bitterish finish, leaving the inside of the mouth dry. The most Ive ever paid for the least... I feel like a cheat but Im still giving it a 10 overall since its probably among the better ones in this ABV range...
A very special beer with low alcohol content, really a lot of hops but the beer has almost no body at all. Quite nice anyway.

Dark cooper color, large tan head. Very floral aroma lots of hops in the aroma. Hoppy beverage, piney bitter with lots of hops flavor. Not very malty, not sweet at all. It's not fair to compare this to Punk IPA or Stone IPA as it's a very if fervent beverage. It's definitely the best NA beer I have ever had. If it was available locally I would have this with lunch often. Please export to the US!
Koper kleurig bier. Met witte schuimkraag. Smaak hoppig en een beetje waterig. Smaak hoppig . Lekker bier met een lage alcoholpercentage . Gedronken met Bryan.

33 cl. bottle from Systembolaget. A beer brought at the Swedish Systembolaget called Nanny State - irony or total lack of humor? Oh, well. Clear amber colour with golden hues. Big, fluffy off-white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, resin, light toast, grapefruit and grasses. Taste is bitter. Light body with a thinner texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes lasting bone dry and bitter with citrus and exotic fruits. Excellent for a Low Alcohol. However, the bitterness and lack of sweetness from malts makes it hard to drink more than one bottle.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. Landscape from red-orange to orange -yellow at the bottom of my glass. Small white head. Poor persistence. Fruity aroma (tropical fruits, citrus), herbs, resin : a few aromatic colors in a chaotic view. Light sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Light body, watery texture, soft carbonation, bitter finish with a sour note. Overall, a beautiful poem with words randomized. I didnt like the result but I liked the experiment.

Bottle.
Clear Dark Golden pour, minimal head.
Very fruity nose. Taste is fruity at first, then a long very bitter finish. Notes of coffee or roasted malts.
Decent ladybeer..

Ska man köra så varför inte. Passar jättebra vid sådana tillfällen och för folk som inte kan dricka starkare grejer

Initial aroma is pleasant, the head builds up nicely but falls apart after a short whole in a soapy manner. The color is much darker than expected. The aroma falls apart after head has dissolved. The taste is downright disappointing. After taste makes me reach for the tooth brush. This is a really a bad tea more than a good beer.

Bottle 330ml at home, poured into a lager glass, ABV 0.5%
Dark copper orange to amber in colour, tall and quite thick off-white head, with great retention, leaving medium lacing on the glass.
Great aroma, lots of hops providing notes of citrus, mandarines, tropical fruits, light caramel malts.
The taste doesnt avoid the heavy maltiness or cereal of low alcohol beers but its not that.. heavy. Some iron too. There are still lots hoppy evidences with a quite strong bitterness on the aftertaste. 
Thin body, high carbonation, very dry palate.
Overall a great beer for what it is, definitely the best low alcohol beer I have had. Certainly beats any radler, both in taste and refreshing taste.

Bottle. Pale amber body, nice medium sized head. Clear fresh hoppy aroma. Darker malt character in the flavour. A little thin and watery towards the end. But one of the very best low alcohol beers. (At home, 26.07.2014)

Pours a dark golden brown clear beer with a good white head. Smells fruity, pines and tropical. Tastes bit roasty, fruity and quite bitter and very flat. Average carbo, thin body and a dry watery texture. Not bad at all. Bit too watery but hey. 0,5%
Bottle. Nice floral hop aroma. Pours dark golden with thin head. Very nice hops and malts, tastes great. A bit watery. Surprisingly great for a low alcoholic beer.
Bottle, 0.5%. Roasted malty aroma. Clear chestnut colour. Small frothy off-white head. The flavour is roasted and malty with a good faintly rough bitterness.
For a low alcohol beer, this is great. More of an infusion than a beer. All about the hops. Some hints of smoked tea in there.
Clear amber, airy offwhite head. Aroma has hops, a little earthy perhaps. Good bitterness, otherwise pretty watery.

Klar, orange-brun med ett stort orange skum. Doft: Påminner mig om hur det luktar av öl i köket dagen efter en fest då folk delvis haft med sig egen öl + humle. Smak: Ojäst öl och rengöringsmedel + humle.
Bra för att vara 0,5, tyckte 1,1 var avsevärt bättre dock. Beska, bitterhet. Nästa lite kaffe toner?!
A splendid low alcohol beer. Although the taste is a bit watery, the hops are quite delicious!

Drunk from 33cl bottle bought at Malting Pot, Brussels. Enjoyable bitter hoppy alcoholic free beer. Slightly watery but very drinkable.
