UPDATED: MAR 11, 2016 UPDATE: Malt profile got enhanced and has more toasty impressions making it not so intense on the hop bittereness anymore and adds more to be a quaffer!
FORMER:
Amber in colour wi a dark white frothy head. Noses mainly of citrus and floral hops with a hint of bready malts. The texture is soft and clearly the hop flavours are predominant. Interesting since most beers in this ABV range have a focus on the malt. The taste is light sweet and bitter and the hop predominates which makes the body very light. Here some more malt could have prepped up the body which would be more to my personal liking. The finish is rather short offering some more floral notes. Different!

Bottle - Reddish amber color with a small and fast disappearing white head, good lacing - Aroma is resinous, piny, citrusy, mango, hints of malt - Flavor is malty, citrusy and resinous - light body, medium bitterness, dry and wattery, good carbonation, resinous bitter finish - hoppy juice with hints of alcohol

Amber clear looks with nice looking head on top. Lots of lacing sticking to the glass. Aroma has grapefruit, citrus, tropical fruits, pines and some caramel. Taste has lots of grapefruit and pines, but this is a bit too hoppy to be in balance. And it could have been more fresh. Of course the mouth feel is very light, but the hops and carbonation makes it a bit smoother. A very good performance in a very hard style. Props to BrewDog, again.
Heldere gouden kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop, caramel. Smaakt bitter, dun, waterig. Toch goed voor een laag percentage.
Raikas ja aromikas tuoksu. Kaunion ruskea väri. Voimakkaat humalat, mutta maku jää tylpäksi. Todella hyvä alkoholiton olut.

Actually my first low alcohol beer ever :) A clear brown beer, color of a strong tea, decent off white head. Aroma is quite typical brewdog, lots of floral, peach and spices. Taste is something different, theres definitely something missing, probably the malts, mostly bitter and quite watery. But t.b.h. its a nice beer, better than most comercial beers with a higher ABV.
Bottle from prisma, järvenpää. Dark copper color, white head. Aroma is all fresh hops. Light bodied but very nicely hopped, lemon notes, dry hoppy ending.

Pours an amber color with a crème head. Aroma is full of citrussy hops, limes and passion fruit. Of course it is, cause its a Brewdog. The taste is a dry bitter, crispy. The taste itself isnt full at all, but the loads of hops give this beer a more than reasonable aftertaste. Leaves a roasted taste at the back of the tongue and a mouthful of hops. Easily drinkable. Weak for an IPA, but as far as low ABV beers are concerned Nanny State is king.
Amber with bit head. Nice explosive hoppy aroma, citrus resin and herbal. Ligh body and strong bitterness, so drinkable but nice beer!
Bottle. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is hoppy, grapefruit, citrusy. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, citrusy. Watery, but still nice bitter finish.

Intense hoppy aroma with scents of citrus, flowers, mango puré and a light roasted scent. Palate is thin with a huge bitterness. A slight toffee flavour and grapefruit peel. Interesting beer, but more of a hop extract then anything else. No balance at all.
Bottle at home. Pours amber, burnt toffee aroma and taste, sweet, dry and bitter, thin.
Flaska från systembolaget. Helt klart den bästa alkoholfria ölen jag druckit. Mycket humle och en hel del bitterhet men ändå saknas lite djup sol alkoholen annars ger.
Flaske: Ravfarvet klar øl med et lille skumhoved. Stor duft af citrus humle. Virkelig overraksende og lækkert. Tynd mundfylde som forventet men med en fin humlet smag af citrus. Overraskende god.
Amber coloured beer with off-white head. Full fruity hop aroma. Taste is missing some depth but the hop makes up for it. Not bad at all.

Bottle. Copper color, off-white head. Hoppy aroma with hints of pine and cookies. Watery, hoppy flavor with a lingering bitter finish. Light body, medium carbonation. Sadly the flavor doesn't equal the appealing aroma and the beer comes off as uneven. Not sure when I'd choose this over a non-alcoholic pils or lager.
Amber colour with small white head. Aroma is very hoppy, hints of tropical fruits. Medium bitterness with a light initial sweetness. Light bodied, thin texture, nice bitter finish though.

Flaska från SB. 
Klar brungul vätska med beige lätt krona.
Mycket fin doft av humlen, tropiskt och citrus. 
Smaken är inte jättekul dock, det märks liksom att alkoholen saknas och den blir blaskig. 
Bra alkofritt alt dock!

33cl bottle pours with a clear deep copper body that supports a thin dirty white head. The aroma offers up malts mixed with pine hops and grassy hops and some spicy hoppiness. It smells alright. The taste begins with malty near neutral notes and then very quickly gets down to business with resiny pine and grassy hops as well as lesser notes of spicy to floral to slightly grapefruit like. It ends a little watery but it does provide a nice hoppy ride.
Bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, grasig, exotische Früchte. Geschmack wässrig, stark hopfig, bitter.
330 ml bottle. Clear dark amber with beige head. Smell is sweet candy fresh light and hoppy. Taste is bitter hoppy some caramel. A bit thin watery body. Enjoyable!

330 ml bottle. Clear amber colour, thin off-white head. Nice aroma of pine and caramel, some tropical fruity notes in there as well. The flavour is a little tea-like, very bitter, with resiny and citrusy hops and no maltiness at all. Thin and watery. Nice statement, but unfortunately not a very enjoyable beer.

Bottle: Served in a shaker:
Medium sized fluffy off white light beige foamy head on top of a clear amber colored beer.
Aromas of hops, some hop flowers, nettle, tea herbs, some resin and light toast.
Flavours of herbs, water, bitters, some hints of hop flowers, hop fruits and herbs, light toast, some malts and resin.
Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, hops, herbs and some malts.
Low carbo, watery mouthfeel, medium yet thin bodied and a watery texture.
Decent but thin...
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Kuparisen ruskea olut valkoisella vaahdolla. Tuoksu on Brewdogmaisen hedelmäinen ja purkkainen. Myös makeaa mallasta. Maku on hieman katkera ja metallinen. Vähän on vetinen ja mauton, mutta onhan tämä alkoholittomaksi oikein hyvä olut. Etenkin tuoksu tekee vaikutuksen.

Très étonnante pour une bière avec aussi peu dalcool. Une couleur assez sombre, une attaque dans le goût assez forte, mais une très faible longueur en bouche dû au faible degré dalcool. Une bière très rafraîchissante mais qui manque quand même un peu dalcool à mon goût.
Flaska från Systembolaget. Mörkt bärnstensfärgad vätska med ljust skum. Doftar frisk och fruktig humle. Karamellig tunn smak med ganska stor beska. Mycket bra lättöl

Bottle @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a dark red colour, long lasting white head. Aroma is medium hoppy (surprisingly!) with notes of resin; additional notes of chamomile. Taste is lightly sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour. Little body, watery texture, average carbonation.

Clear mahogany with one finger frothy light brown head and some lacing. Strong aroma has grapefruit and spruce, some tropical fruit nuances and caramel malt underneath. Very light, bit watery, strong bitterness and quite dry but fruity nuances balance, long and bitter finish which has some mango tones in the end, standard carbonation. Light and bitter as h*ll, not that easy to drink. Not one of my favorites but this has some appeal like the finish delivering mango as a kind of bonus.

Thanks Srđan & Nataa! Bottle at Csak a Jó Sör. Got this for us to try to show them the versatility of beers. Bronze body. Lovely piney peach ice tea aroma, light lemony notes, sweetish. Empty taste, of course, light tropical notes, sweetish, light bitterness. Great for what it is.
Klar brun farve med lyst skum. Lukt av fruktig humle og gress. Smak av fruktig humle og karamell. Noe bitter avslutning. Vinmonopolet.

Bottle at S&G.
APPEARANCE: clear darker blond beer, small unstable off white head.
NOSE: hoppy, lytchee, very fruity and fresh.
TASTE: fresh, hoppy, dry, bitter aftertaste. Amazing for its ABV!

330ml bottle from Brewdog shop.
Bubbly off white head disappears quickly, good lacing. Clear dark amber body. Good nose of pine and citrus. Flavour less good, grass, straw, a little biscuity, lingering bitter grass. Mouthfeel is thin and watery, medium carbonation. Decent for a near enough alcohol free beer, refreshing enough but a lightweight among the usual Brewdog efforts.
Bottled. Pours hazy brown with a big light brown head. Smells a bit sour, fruity hoppy. Tastes clear bitter fresh hoppy, watery with a similar finish.

Bottle from Asahiya. Thick piney hop and rough crude tea aromas. Light golden amber color. Very mild caramel / trashy harsh hops / ends up more like a heavy tea than anything else. Thin body, with a rasty hop texture. Nice try. Falls off fast in mid palate and finish is empty. Another novelty from the novelty mongers. Next.

Red, dark brown beer with a beige head. Very fruity and floral hoppy aroma. Very watery body. Very harsh, dry and grassy bitterness. The best non-alcoholic beer but this is like hopped water, nothing else.

Brew dog have themselves narrow criteria with this one, and its quite nice overall, but amazing when compared to other "near beers". Reminds me a bit of the pretty things 1942 recipe remake, but in a good way

This is important! Its 0,5%! Brewdog proves successfully that its possible to create an excellent beer with almost no alcohol in it. Its a taste of a warm summer night. Flowers, citrus and hops. Lots of hops!
As they say: "Plug in, kick back and enjoy as we welcome to the stage the worlds first low ABV beer officially cranked up to 11"

Bottle 33 cl.
Dark amber with off-white head. Grass and floral hops. Lightly malty. Distinctively bitter taste.

(Backlog) Bottle. (from sweden not too sure which rating is correct) Golden pour with white head. Hoppy aroma, grassy, herbal and spice tones. Flavors follow although a bit light on body, not surprising. Almost the best "beer" of the night even though its .5%.
330ml bottle. Pours orange brown with a medium head. Aroma is dusty toffee and piney mango hops. Taste has carbonated water and toffee, with a little bitter resin in the finish.
Au palais, houblon et citron mais malheureusement le faible taux dalcool nuit à la longueur en bouche.

Butelka 0.3L. Bursztynowe, klarowne. Piana biała, średniopęcherzykowa, szybko dziurawi się i opada.
Aromat głównie amerykańskich chmieli, żywiczny, owocowy, średniointensywny. Do tego aromaty karmelowe.
W smaku dziwne, wyraźna goryczka ale taka papierowa, nieprzyjemna i poza chmielem niewiele. Odczucie w ustach bardzo wodniste, wręcz suche, nieprzyjemne, zupełnie nie przypominające piwa i drażniące.
Pachnie jak IPA a smakuje jak napar z chmielu. Woda z goryczką. Bardzo dziwne wrażenie. Raczej nie warto, choć pomysł na mocno chmielone amerykańskim chmiele piwo bezalkoholowe bardzo mi się podoba.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 Aroma; lots of hops, resin, pine, citrus peel, and malts of some caramel or roasted sweet type.
Modest head, dark amber to copper coloured beer, some steps of lacings.
Taste; resin style, hops, grassy smooth stuff, malts in the background, some caramel hints.
To palate very smooth, lively carbonation.
Finishes slightly sticky, slightly dry, still the hops playing a bitter role, with notes of roasted caramel malts, lingering a bit on the way. Really decent for a low-alcohol alternative.
33cl brown btl 0.5%abv.

Kaatuu lasiin mahonginruskeana ja kirkkaana, vaahto on noin 2 sormen paksuinen ja melko kuohkean näköinen. Haju on vahvan puumaisen ja greippisen humaloitu, lievää pähkinäisyyttäkin on joukossa, mutta humalointi on pääosassa. Maku jää jalkoihin, kuten odotettu. Se on jopa yllättävän pliisu. Jos nyt jotain koittaa kaivaa, niin sitruksinen humalointi on läsnä, ja hieman puumaisuuttakin on joukossa, mutta TODELLA vähän. Suutuntuma on vetinen ja humaloinnin tuomana hieman kitkerä, koska mallasrunkoa ei ole tukemassa. Haju on miellyttävä, mutta maku täysin tyhjä, vettä saa hanastakin ja siitä ei tarvitse maksaa kolmea euroa.

Quite dark in color. Light brown / dark amber, but a bit more translucent.
Nose: quite pleasant actually, American hop profile
Taste: ok, quite watery of course, but still tasteful with lots of hops and bitterness.
Conclusion: a very good softdrink

Clear brown. Quite a hoppy aroma, fruity and floral. Body is thin and watery. Flavour has fruity hop but generally quite malty even with a touch of caramel. Pleasantly bitter. Would make for a good thirst quencher on a warm day.

330ml bottle @Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. End of 2012.
A very tasty low ABV one. Some citrusy and grassy aromas. Taste is quite hoppy. Light body, average carbonation.
Backlog. Decent try for a non-alcoholic that actually tastes of something, too bad the dominant taste becomes a chemical hoppy-one that resembles a dishwasher.

Fluffy, dirty-cream coloured head over well-carbonated rusty orange beer. Exotic fruithops jumping out of the glass upon pouring, reinforced with exotic Thai herbs. Phenomenal nose, some caramel, generally speaking sweet-smelling. Bitter, slightly wry, wood or plywood; fruitiness is still there, but only a fraction from what was going on in the nose - even retronasal not very outspoken aromas. Finish has something of old dried meat and corroded metal. Obviously light, and, lets face it, watery. Aftertaste regains some of the fruity hops. A tour de force, theres no discussion here. The bitterness wont allure kids, Im afraid, but in my eyes, this ought to be the 21st centurys tafelbier to be poured to the youngster on holiday camps, schools, and the kitchen table.

Appearance: Clear amber/ruby with 3 finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Lychee, mango, apricot, grapefruit and musky.
Taste: Very bitter, low sweet and sour.
Palate: Smooth slightly grainy texture, light body, average carbonation, very dry, very bitter, tastes chemically.
Comments: A touch disappointed but there was a glass lace. Too chemical.

Bottle at restaurant in Stockholm. An interesting experience of a low-alcohol beer, gives an impression overall of being stronger than it is.
This one offers quite a crazy situation. Whole hoppy and citrus aroma with nearly no taste. And behind that not exisiting taste there is no body. Nice try to make a low abv beer. Yeah, try.

33cl bottle from Edeka Mohr, Bonn 02/2014. bb 06/14
Pillows of peach-qumquat-lychee hop soap floating over water on carbonated air. Close to drinking analcoholic hop tea, much like some of my own dryhopping ice tea experiments, without the backbone. Intense fruit peel, wildflower (dandelion) and pine mid bitterness, without any body, sloping into a plastic finish. Not bad for a 0,5% ultra hop kick, helplessly hipster-style, but too frustratingly welterweight for repeated drinking.

Actually I didnt realise that this beer was a low-alc when purchasing it - I guess I wouldnt have paid that amount of money then....Anyway, when we havent had anything else left to drink we finally opened the bottle. It poured out of the bottle in a clear golden colour with low head and medium to thin body. Aroma was quite nice - hops and spices. Taste was worse: Thin hops, thin spices, thin citrus, thin herbs. Not THAT bad for a low-alc but thin and quite tasteless anyway.

Bottle thanks to Blomster. Shared with Ferris at 411 Aloft in Asheville. Pours reddish gold. Nose and taste of malt, pine, hops and light tree bark. More bark in the taste and hop in the nose. Not bad for the ABV.

0,33 l bottle, batch 136. A dark red golden in the glass, nice head. Like a smooth IPA on the nose. Starts with herb and bitter grapefruit, malt in the background. Later a lot of longlasting watery cardboard and citrus dish soap. Wasted 3,49 Euro.

Rated on 4-25-2010 (Label: Batch 484 and Best before: 15/01/211) This beer pours a medium sized fizzy beige head with a short retention, deep orange body, fast rising carbonation, and spotty lacing. The aroma is malt, citrus, pine, and bitter hops. The taste is lightly bitter, earthy and a subtle hint of malt. This beer has a moderate dry finish. The palate is thin and this beer is light bodied. Overall, the aroma is more pleasing than the weird flavor. This beer left me not wanting it again.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je opravdu výrazné a krásné chmelové se silným nádechem ananasu a oříků. Pěna je světle hnědá, jemná, vysoká a pomalu mizící. Barva samotného piva je tmaví opálová. Bottle - Some spicey malts like caraway and rye with a punch of hops. Clear amber with a thin beige head. Hoppy bitterness without alot of the hops but quite a bit of the grains. A lingering spiciness that is actually not bad. Much better than I anticipated.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2015 Clear amber/brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of malts, tropical fruits, hops. Flavour is fruits and hops, with a nice bitter aftertaste. Thin and watery. Not bad for a 0.5%.

Botella de 33 cl en el lupulo. Junio de 2011. Una de las mejores cervezas sin alcohol que he probado. Un cuerpo ligero con 0.5 vol y un increíble sabor a hervaceos y lupulo, aunque claro sin la chispa del alcohol. Regusto amargo contenido pero bueno también. Muy buena en su estilo.

33CL bottle at home, dark amber beer with a medium head, aroma is awesome very hoppy. But the taste.... Watery soap like with a bit of bitterness... damn i wished for an awesome beer i could fall in love with, but instead i got this ....

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 Small white head with hoppy aroma. Caramel colored body. Much less hops in the taste, thus a bit deceiving because it lacks thickness in mouth. Still a good alternative to untasty non alcoholic beers.

Color: nice clear amber beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: good herbal and spices notes with hoppy presence and malt touch. Taste: great taste, really tasteful with malt and hops equilibrium. Floral and herbal presence. Aftertaste: watery taste with really sweet bitterness notes.

Delikat utseende, mørk gylden med medium skum. Humle og malt i duften, god. Smaken er mildt fruktig og malt. Lite å by på i munnfølelelsen, og tynn/medium konsistens. Dog meget godt alternativ dersom du er på vannvogna .

Provata per curiosità, ma non mi ha entusiasmato. Gli manca il gusto rancido delle birre analcoliche, ma non basta non avere qualcosa per essere una buona birra. Acquosa e, questo sì, discretamente amarina. E giusto sperimentare, comunque, ma anche capire gli errori.
Pours a chestnut colour with a thin white head. Decent enough hoppy smell. Taste is a bit like sparkling water, not for me.

Bottle. What a great aroma! What a horrible taste! The former is citric with lots of lychee and oranges, slightly grassy as well. No trace of the nauseating aroma of unfermented worthat usually makes nonalko beers so bad. But as for the taste, it is reminiscent of bitter water. Surprisingly, the aroma fades while drinking, so the beer comes across almost devoid of flavour. Also, the bitterness is a bit harsh, directed at the center of the throat and almost only there. Bad stuff but good looking and with a great aroma.

Bottle at SlutFest 2011 on 04/23/2011. Clear golden amber body with a small frothy off white head. Big floral and resiny hop aroma. Big floral and resiny hop flavor with some earthy notes. Medium light body with moderate carbonation.

Riktigt fin doft av humle med inslag av citrus och barrträd. Kopparfärgad vätska med låg skumstabilitet. Första smakintrycket är bra beska sen händer inte mycket mer. Därefter infinner sig en unken ton som om den blivit torrhumlad för länge? Tanken att brygga ett välhumlat lågalkoholöl är helt rätt, men tyvärr är inte smaken riktigt hundra. Mer sötma och efterbeska hade varit på sin plats.

33cl bottle. The beer is brown with medium head.
NOSE : strong citrus aromas of zest, pomelo, lemon and grapefruit. Pine and lavender aromas as well. It has also a tart like background. 
SIP : the beer is as thick as water and has the same texture. Delicately carbonated. There is almost nothing sweet about it. It has a very distanced brown toast like flavour to it. A bit sour and very bitter. Bitterness covers almost all the flavour spectrum till the end. And the end is fairly long for this kind of beer. Aftertaste is mineral and bitter. The bitterness has this herbal deepness, mixed a bit with citrus seeds. There is also a little hint of burned malt in the background. 
OVERALL ; very narrow taste but what a hop bomb. I prefer this millions times more then a lemonade.

0,33 l bottle BB 04. Oct 14 
Nice low alc Pale Ale. 
spruce, citrus, herbs, amber, clear, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, thin feel, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation,

(Bottle): Pours a dark amber with a small off white head. Subdued aroma of citrus fruits, malt, caramel. Flavour is relatively hoppy, citrus fruits, caramel, malt. Touch of bitterness gives it a nice kick. Its a good effort for such a low abv, was expecting much worse.

330 ml bottle. Clear, dark amber color, short-life medium off-white head, caramel and grassy hoppy aroma, light watery body, smooth fizziness, sweet creamy caramel taste, decent grassy and citric hoppy bitter palate with toffee notes. A little bit chewy  brew.

Smells nice fresh and hoppy. 
Nice white foam. Well carbonated also.
Tastes hoppy and slightly bitter. But it doesnt have the beer feel.
The palate is rather annoying.
I was hoping this would be a great beer but i am disappointed.

Bottle 0.33l. Pours copper to brown with a off white head. Aroma is typical IPA. Lots of hops, resin etc.. So far very good. Taste is medium bitter, no sweetness. Hop and fruit flavour is reduced. Of course the alcohol is missing but nevertheless a really good alcohol free (almost) beer.
Drank from a bottle at home. A very interesting beer! It tastes like a normal, well hopped beer but misses the kick of alcohol.

Pours chestnut with a low rocky beige collar. Deeply aromatic with a huge waft of mango, overripe melon and lychee over background coffee bean roast and citrus. Fine soapy hop aggressive with grapefruit and tropical citrus; coffee again, a shaving of nut, truffle-like bitterness. Only the roundedness, finish and buzz of alcohol is missing. Now, if they could just master a calorie and alcohol-free IPA that gets you shit-faced...
Gedronken bij dutchdrebus. Kleur is bruin van kleur en helder. Ruikt hoppig en fris. Smaakt wel hoppig en bitter maar vooral ook waterig.
Hops and a little citrus. Normal bodied. Bitter, dry with a long aftertaste.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2013 Bottle at The Broker in Oslo. Resin and pine shavings and sap and all of that. Has some cola malz and peanuts notes with a strong toasted brown malt. Harsh and astringent hop bitterness with prickly and lively hop acid. Grapefruit juice, wood, nuts (Chinook?), some dog food malt and a touch of artificial sweetener. Sourish, grainy, husky amber malt finish. The body is interesting, though its thin for sure, as expected, but its full enough to work. The Christmas tree pine resin note is off-putting but I commend BrewDog for pulling off such a low gravity beer with so much malt character.
shared bottle at a bar. poured a light brown colour with a thick white head. hops, grass notes, pine, lot of flavours with no alcohol. like drinking ice tea.

Insanely hopped indeed. Like an Ipa but it is somewhat watered down unfortunately. The Emelisse 2.5 might have 2 percent more alcohol but is a masterpiece where this is just good. Bottle at the Twaalf Balcken in Den Burg.

@ Ölkväll o bryggning i Källna (15/11-13). Flaska från Systembolaget (12:-). Trevlig, humlig doft med med citrustoner. Smaken däremot är som välhumlat vatten med en löjligt stor beska. Eftersmaken är bara besk.

ivory white head that disappears with structured lacing. hazlenut brown colour. aroma of tropical fruits, passion fruit, bit of caramel, malt. taste is passionfruit with a long bitter finish. thin watery mouthfeel, medium carbonation. so, this is what hopwater tastes like :)  bottle 33 cl / bbf aug-2014

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a clear dark amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is dominated by the spicy hops as one might expect. The flavour is weak bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a thin texture. The palate is watery despite the abundance of hops. This beer would be better with alcohol. Hey, theres a novel idea! Fine for a driver, but not for anyone who is walking!
Amber with fluffy white head. Hoppy aroma with citrus, blackcurrant, pineapple, passion fruit, floral. Bitter taste, light body, thin texture, average carbonation, long bitter finish.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2014 Frisk duft av citrus frukter og krydder. Lite skum, noe langs kant. fin gyllen nøttebrun farge. Litt tørr smak av citrus.som ble sittende igjen som en tørr smak i munnen etter hver slurk.
Zippie van rikkie. Licht bruin met wat bezinksel van iets... Aroma is erg goed. Mooi bier voor 0.5 smaak is niet super sterk.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 @ de twaalf balcken den burg. Bijzonder 0,5 bier door de extreme hop ruik en proef je niet dat het een alcohol arm bier is. Wel iets waterige dan andere brew dogs mooi alternatief als je geen behoefte hebt aan alcohol

Floral, earthy and grassy hop aroma, a bit parfumic 
Nice dark red clear colour with frotty head 
Really bitter, taste brittish. Kinda lika an ESB but with less caramell. 
Light and dry with average carbonation 
 A really nice ale for beeing low alcohol. My number one choice when have to drink non-alcoholic

Very nice dark red with nice off-white head. good lacing too. Aroma is like sniffing a fresh hop bag. Nice green and earthy hops. oooww! this is going to be epic. Mouth feel is carbonated water. aftertaste is water with some earthy, citrus and grassy hops. Overall: Wow, this beer! It tricks you with its sexy appearance, excellent lacing, and fresh hop aroma. After that, its just carbonated water with some hop juice.

Bottle at van Erp Groningen. Reddish brown colour, small off white head. Aroma has caramel, hops. Fresh taste. At first theres not much taste and flavour, but lateron the hops show up. Citrus, lychee, orange. Short to medium finish

Bottle (batch 179, bbe 020914 it says). Amber, like the stuff they found t-rex dna in in jurassic park. Lovely hoppy citrusy, slight goosy, nose. Some green tea notes. Light body, watery. Green tea. Green hops. This is a beer best enjoyed just by smelling it. The flavour isnt overly offensive, but theres just too much green leaves there to be nice.

Bottle 33 cl, batch #097, BBE 30.04.2014. Pours amber in color with an off-white head. Burnt bready and slightly nutty in aroma, feels quite nice actually. Bitter taste but feels watered down naturally. Aromawise this was a good one, but the body doesnt do justice as it is here. Faint nutty notes in the backround in aftertaste.

330ml bottle from Brewdog online shop. Pours amber brown with big bubbles and a frothy head, which quickly goes. Lots of hop aromas, pine and grapefruit dominate. Taste is thin and bitter, some iron or mineral note. OK.

Mousse qui tient longtemps, une couleur ambrée fort jolie.
Je nai jamais été étonné par une bière avec peu ou sans alcool, cependant je dois avouer que lexplosion des houblons à la première gorgée est une super intéressant avec un côté floral et citronné, mais le manque dalcool fait que cest très court. Très bien pour les femmes enceintes en manque de houblons !
(bottle 27/09-2013) hoppy aroma, low beige head, clear amber color, light bitter, hoppy after taste, thin body. Batch #173, BB date 28-05-2013.

Heavily hopped to make up for the lack of alcohol. Strangely fresh without the alcohol kick. A novelty beer not to be taken seriously.

Amber pour with tan head and lace. Aroma of roasted malt and earthy hops. Dry roasted malt start with earthy hops. Medium body with good carbonation. ok for what it is

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2013 21/IX/13 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - BB: 2/VIII/14 (2013-885) 
Clear red orange to amber beer, irregular light beige head, pretty stable, little adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, exotic fruits, pineapple, passion fruit, some sweet mango, piny, resinous, hint of toasted malts, citrus fruits. MF: ok carbon, light body. Clear deep orange to red beer, irregular light beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet ripe fruits, bit sugary, raisins, caramel, citrus and grapefruit, brown sugar, toast, bit of banana. MF: ok carbon, light body. Taste: toast, little grassy, bitter hops, bit of citrus. And fresh its probably even better, didnt know my bottle was gonna be past its BBE when I bought it online (just last August).

Dark copper coloured beer with a nice permanent off-white head. The aroma is typical BrewDog hop overload, but its not very persistent. The taste is mostly watery with some bitterness. The mouthfeel is obviously very thin. Theres a slight dry bitter finish. Good for a low alcohol beer, but its on the edge where Id rather just drink water.
Bottle. Pours clear amber. Aroma is grass and some bread. Taste is quite bitter. A bit watery, quite fizzy. Not bad for such a low alcohol beer.

Bottle. Pours a murky darker amber beer with a big, fluffy off white head on top. Aroma is great and hoppy, pines, grapefruit and grassy hops are all present. Almost like an IPA in the aroma. Flavor is medium bitter and has an earthy feel to it. Flavor is full, but the mouthfeel is a bit watery and the lack of alcohol is definitely noticeable. Yet a very nice, low alcohol beer.

Bottled. A hazy copper-red with a foamy off-white head. The usual Brew Dog nose of citrus and pine, but with a hint of honey sweetness. Looks and smells fantastic! The lack of alcohol makes this unsurprisingly thin, but its dry, hoppy, and refreshing, with a touch honey and citrus.

Brewdog. Nanny starte. 0,5 %, duft, simcoe humle,virkelig kraftig duft af humle. smag: frisk, med store smag af humle, da øllet er på 0,5 % så smutter smagen af malt også hurtigt, og fylden er meget lav, det der holde denne øl opper er de store mængde humle. den smager super godt

330ml bottle from K-Citymarket Sello, Espoo
BBE 30-04-14 - Pours dark reddish brown with a small bubbly head. Aroma of floral hops, exotic fruits, grass and berries. Taste is watery, juicy and hoppy with notes of berries and floral notes with some hints of tea and earthy notes. Finish is carbonated and watery. Feels like carbonated ice tea with loads of bitter hops. Wish it was more fruity and fresh.
Smak och doft av humle, gräs, örter, citrus med toner av tropisk frukt. Väldigt bitter, torr med konstiga bismaker. Ingen hit.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 Bottle. Great aroma consisting of citruses: grapefruit, orange, mango and also pines. Pale clear with very nice head. Beer has quite strong bitter finish partially as a result of very light body. Nanny State is thin and watery - as expected from NA beer, with grapefruit and grass in flavour. Very nice (almost :)) no alcohol beer.
Edit 2017 - completely different beer, more like a bitter, more caramel, worse hop aroma.

Bottle at JFs, from BD online, 17/08/13.
Pours dark amber with a good off white covering.
Nose is hops, toasted malt, bitter orange, light tropicals - great for the ABV !
Taste comprises light hop bill, tea bags, orange pith, hint of tropical fruits.
Light in body, a little thin and watery as one would expect, crisp clean finish.
Great work for the ABV !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle, dark brown with a thin lasting white head, tangerine and coffee nose, dry-bitter with peppery, floral and tropical fruit notes, but on a flaccid watery body. Brewdog should take notes from the German malz brewers on how to give a low-alc drink a proper body.

Bottle 33cl, a clear dark amber beer with good off white head. Nose is very hopy on grapefruit, resin and coconut notes. Aroma is on lemon, pine and resin, body is watery but whole beer is properly done and tasty, very nice low alcohol.
Per niente male, seppur il grado alcolico praticamente inesistente. Lamaro è deciso e avvolgente, un succo di luppolo, e per chi è amante del luppolo è il massimo.
On bottle from Vinmonopolet Sandefjord. Dark golden color, good foam. Good hoppy aromas, fruitiness and citrus. Medium/light body & complexity. Good bitterness. Pretty good

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma of citrusly hops, orangepeel, light pine. Flavor is citrus, light piney hops. Thin watery body, lively carbonation, rather bitter finish. Good for a low ABV beer. 100813

33cl bottle. Looks like a beer, if a little more clear and still looking than a normal ale. Good foamy head. Big dry hopped aroma, and this follows through in the flavor. The body of this though is so weak, but that is perfectly expected. If I had to look for a non alcoholic beer this would certainly be it. Tasty hops. Y

Bottled 0,33L. Dark brown color, very good bubbly aspect, foamy and medium creamy head of good duration. Little roast cereals nose with rumors of hop and resin. Interesting and realy unusual taste, prickly and braced hop aroma, very bittersh final mouth. Agreeable low alcoholic beer, indeed valid one.
UPDATED: JUL 27, 2013 Bottle 0.33l at William K. Kurvi, Helsinki. Batch 097. BBE 30-04-14. Colour is clear dark orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Hops and water.
Clear orange coloured with a small off white head. Fruity aroma of caramel, hops, pine needles, grass. Fruity flavour of hops, grass and pine needles. Dry hoppy finish.

Bottle from Brew Dog, Camden. Pours dark reddish brown with a short off-white head. Citrus fruits and light caramel malts on the nose, like a solid pale ale. Taste is really watery, retains a fair carbonation but the flavour is a little too absent. It's cool they gave it a go, but I don't think I'll order many more of these.

Bottle. Copper red with an off white foam. Aromas are light toffee and spruce with floral notes. Soapy with yeast and some nuttiness. Cardboard with a herbal leafiness. Flavours are light malts with copper coin metal and peppery, bitter spruce. Dry and gritty on the finish. Its a very good low alcohol beer brew but not a great beer.

330 ml. Lys brun, uklar med godt lysebrunt skum. Humledominert aroma av sitrusfrukt. Mye bitterhet i munnen, med humlesmak, men mangler maltbasen, så den blir for tynn. Lite ettersmak, men bitterheten sitter lenge. (Havnabakken, 10.06.13)

0,33l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Clear, deep brown color, medium beige head. Strong grassy hop odor. Intensive grassy and piney hop aroma. The malty flavours do not appears, its a bit watery. Because of that the pure hoppy flavours can not prevail. Light bitter taste. Absolutely no body, but the pure hoppy bitterness. Slick texture, average carbonation. Short hoppy finish. Weak, hoppy-based beer. The bitterness isnt pleasure, but wierd due to the lack of the malt. Its like hopped water. Knowing the aim of Brewdog with this beer, they succeeded. Statement: There is no good IPA without good malt fundament and alcohol. The odor is intensive, but thats all...

Fresh hop nose with lychee and musk.  Pours a medium amber with a fluffy head.  Look, you know what?  Forget all the drivel, this rocks.  For an effectively no alcohol beer what Brewdog have achieved here is amazing.  Plenty of flavour, slightly thin mouthfeel, but if thats all the bad you can say about something that weighs in at half a percent its doing well.  Very well indeed.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 May 2013 - Bottle in the Stockholm sunshine.  Sparkling dark orange beer.  Very hoppy - grapefruit, floral, foamy in mouth.  Interesting low alcohol beer.  (2.1)
Dec 2014 - Keg at Brewdog.  Dark reddy orange, hazy, small white head.  Aroma is pine-forward.  Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation.  Taste is thin caramel, dental rinse, watery, papery, hop tea.  Not great.  (1.6)
Share with Bish and Danny. I was incredulous that Danny liked this more than a funky E, and I still am, although standing is proving a little difficult today.
Smelt of lovely hops. Tasted of water. How much can the smell make up for the taste? About equal on here but thats gotta be wrong right?

Bottle at Brewdog Brum. Smelt totally delicious - hops aplenty. But then, yep.... no taste. Not surprising really, as there is no booze here. But liked the stench. Cant remember if I really did enjoy this more than Mikkeller Funky E, but I think I did and it really seemed to annoy Dom (who was literally incredulous), so Im standing by my statement.

Bottled, not really fresh, actually almost at its BB date. Clear amber color, medium frothy off-white head, some debris floating around. Aroma of wort, bread, cereal, vegetable broth. Some citrussy hop. Medium bitterness, citrussy. Quite metallic. I know I should have drank this much fresher, but right now its quite horrible.

.33l bottle from Only Good Beer in Budapest. Not sure why I picked this up but it is at least interesting. Looks like a beer, if a little more clear and still looking than a normal ale. Good foamy head. Big dry hopped aroma, and this follows through in the flavor. The body of this though is so weak, but that is perfectly expected. In the end it tastes like really dry hopped wort. If I had to look for a non alcoholic beer this would certainly be it. Tasty hops

330ml bottle. No idea how it looks as i drank it out of the bottle. As far as überhopped light beers go, thos was actually quite nice. Nice hop prescence, albeit with a bitterness on the border to sour.

(33 cl bottle from Systembolaget; Batch 335; BBD: October 28th 2013) Pours a clear, dark amber with medium, white head that leaves beautiful lace and shows good retention. As the bolag had received this beer in October already I was a bit sceptical about the vitality and freshness of the hops but the aroma puts this worry to shame as its still dominated by pleasant, herbal and sprucy hops although theyre beginning to show some age. Considering how my own hop forward homebrews age to the point of dullness after only three months I can only imagine that this one must have been packed with hops from birth. Watery texture, light body, soft carbonation and a short and slightly bitter finish. Taste is well - watery with a little hop juice bitterness leftover and a minuscle amount of sweetness to balance it out. I think a beer like this should have an expiration date of no more than 6 months after production.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear amber/brown with frothy head. 
Aroma citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit, hops. 
Taste bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin, dry, watery. 
Strange beer, the funny thing is Im missing the alcohol :). Some low ABV beers do not have that problem but in this case im missing the alcohol.

330ml bottle. Dark copper amber colour, frothy tan head that diminishes leaving lots of lacing and aroma of tropical fruit hop & peach with a hint of wood & pine. Taste is watery malt with roasted, tea, wood, pine and fruity peach hop notes, alongside a lingering bitterness. Light watery body, well carbonated, quite drinkable for the low alcohol level.

Bottle from SB. In many ways Brewdogs most extreme beer, at least the most unbalanced. Massively hopped with no body at all to carry all that fruity, dirty, resinously bitter overload of hops. The best use of it i to blend it with boring ales with more body. Impossible to rate fairly.
330 ml bottle. Lots of earthy, flowery and fruity hop notes with some faint sweet malt notes in behind. Taste is very bitter, traces of malt notes but the bitterness dominates totally.

Pours a clear brown with a fluffy white head. Aroma is hoppy, twiggy, pine, floral, "knäckebröd", fruity. Taste: very bitter, notes of "knäckebröd", hops, very watery mouthfeel (as expected). Very unbalanced. An OK low ABV brew that would benefit with a slightly more heavy body...

This is one weird and good brew. Massive aroma, floral hops, spices, pine. Extremely piney down the stretch.  Coppar with a firm fluffy head. Body is light when it hits the tongue but the amount of bitterness and carbonation balance makes up for it and makes this a good brew. Very tasty and something I will buy more off.
Bottle @ buitenlust. Aroma is big big hops, some bready caramel. Flavour has strong hop bitterness, mild malt note. Very impressive for .5!
Bottle, Csakajosor. Poured amber with an off-white head. Pine, citrus, grapes in the aroma. Light taste and body (as expected), with a bitter finish. Pretty good.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2013 Bottle from Systembolaget. Amber with a small white head. Aroma is fresh hops, grapefruit, pine, grass, some metallic notes, some roasted notes. Taste is mainly bitter with a piney bitter and watery finish. Body is thin. Good for being a non-alcoholic brew.

Bottle from BrewDog website. A dark brown beer with a strong red fruity and hoppy flavour, roasted, chocolate and marmalade notes with a slight thin but very hoppy finish. Superb considering its almost non-existent alcohol content.

Flaske fra Polet: nydelig farge, flott skum som varer og herlig, intens aroma av amerikanske humler (grapefrukt og furunål). Et meget interessant alkoholfritt øl, men den har ingen maltkropp til å balansere all den herlige humlen. Blir derfor veldig bitter, og ettersmaken er bare metallisk.

csakajosor:hu
 Sötétebb, kicsit vöröses, aranysárga színe van, aminek a tetejét egy sokszor mosott gatya fehér színű, közepes méretű, nagy buborékos hab díszíti, de csak korlátozott ideig. Illata fenyőrügyes, szőlős, kissé élesztős és visszafogott. Ízében is érezni a fenyőgyantás aromát, olyan, mintha friss fenyőgallyakat főztek volna meg teának, sok vízzel, hozzá adagoltak volna egy kis édes, szagos szőlőt, hogy ne legyen annyira keserű és egy kis élesztőt, hogy ne legyen annyira édes + megfejelték volna egy jó adag komlóval amcsi komlóval, hogy legyen min csodálkozni. Teste, na az nincs, viszont buborékokkal elvan látva rendesen. Utóíze vékony, kesernyés. Na, ez az általam eddig kóstolt egyetlen igazán iható alkoholmentes sör. Vannak még csodák!

Pale amber body with particles and a small white head. Very nice hoppy aroma with lots of grapefruit and caramel, as well as lemon, peach and honey. Surprisingly nice flavour for such a low abv beer, very dry hoppy with grapefruit, pine.
Yes the beer you can drink anyway. But feel awkward and boring. Sad attempt to make a beer. The scent is thin like the taste. The aftertaste is detingen clue of.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2013 excellent appearance of dark golden colour and brownish white head; aroma of grapefruit, tastes of grapefuit and hoppy bitterness; almost perfect NA beer.

Back log from Spring of 2011 in Scotland; poured an orange type color. Dont remember if this was bottle or tap.  Aroma of citrus, pine, and fruit.  A bit thin on the palate as expected; a touch watery; but good beer for the style.  Packed a nice hop presence.  Better than expected.

Bottle, bought @ Bierzwerg.de.
Pours dark golden with a large, frothy, off-white head. Aroma has grapefruit, pine, light chalky, some mild toasted caramel. Medium carbonation, light and extremely dry mouthfeel. Flavour has hops aplenty, pine, grass. Quite sharply bitter.

Bottle bought at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Dark copper color with huge quick disapearing off-white head. Sweet dark malt in aroma together with strong hoppy aroma. Strong hoppy bitter taste with pines, grapefruit, tropical fruit. Best N/A beer.

The best low alcohol beer in the marked.
citrus, hay, caramel, grass, amber, clear, frothy, medium sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium body, lively, bitter,

33cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Clear dark amber/brown colour, off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit and pine, toasted and light roasted malts, mint, Fishermans Friend, coffee and mint. Flavour is pine, toasted nuts, watered down coffee, brown malts, light mint, firm pine hoppy bitter finish, lingering strong bitterness underneath. Light-bodied. Not an easy drink, but I quite like this.

Bottle as a warm-up to THE Barley Wine Tasting, London. Thanks to Paul for this BD specimen. Pours clear amber with a fine, foamy white head. Classic BrewDog aroma, some pee, pine - lovely. Flavor is not so nice, with lots of astringent bitterness, pine needles, faint toasty dough, big dry pine. Light bodied with average carbonation. Herbal and piney to finish, abrasive, with zero sweetness. Not great. Like drinking bitter pine water.

Tasted from the bottle, on 01/12/2012.
Pours of pure clear dark amber reddish color.
Aroma is extra intense, extremely hoppy, grassy and floral.
Taste is interesting, quite sweet though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Thin rust brown colour. Impressive hop performance for the feeble attempt at alcohol here. Bit of a burr and a lot of presence. Easily the best low, or no alcohol based beer Ive ever had.

Went back to this after a long while. Think I had the 1.1% version last, and was not too happy with it. This one pours a nice and clear deep amber with low white head. Aroma is hoppy with distinct floral and citric notes. Theres a hint of caramel sweetness as well. Taste is quite unique, distinctly hoppy bitter from the start but not overly so, with a pungent bitter distinct finish. Light body (for obvious reasons) is the only real drawback.

Bottle from brewdog.skBig white head, clear deep amber colour. Aroma hops, caramel, wood, notes of petrol and wall paint, quite industrial lol. Taste is heavy bitter hop explosion, medium caramel, tar, elderberry, medium tart. The body is light. Finish tart and heavy bitter. Either the hop, or malt profile got a bit out of hand to create this burning forest sensation. Interesting experiment, but not very likable one.
061112: Light hazel thin very hoppy almost non-alcoholic beer. Much bitterness on the tongue. absolute no balance but fun projegt.
Very unbalanced. Hoppy and bitter but no malty body at all. Aftertaste reminds me of chemicals..

Bottle at Brewdog Camden with Sarah. Pours a clear deep amber with a tan head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has lots of resin with a hint of pine and a bit of an earthy grain backbone. Flavor starts with pine but grows to bitter resin with a hint of grain backing.

Smell of hops, citrus. Dark bronze colour, high light brown head. Heavy bitterness to start with which ends up in being a mild-flavoured IPA. Wateriness of course due to lack of alcohol, but in a moderate way. Very sharp carbonation. Some basement aromas in aftertaste.

Rating given compared to other nonalcoholics Ive tasted.
A really good low alcohol beer with amply sized hops. Good! Nice to have a great tasting beer when you have to drive.

Deep brown amber with a thick creamy lasting, lacy beige head. Thick. The smell of BrewDog hops is clear right away with malt, caramel and citrus orange and peach. Soft carbonation on the medium thin body. Tastes a bit like pine, grass with caramel, some floral elements. A bit too plant like and watery but defiantly different without that much malt.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear reddish amber with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is hoppy (with notes of lemon and citrus) and a little malty. Flavour is hoppy in a subdued way with a very dry finish. A little watery.

Pours an amber color with an off-white head. The nose is quite nice. Heavy on the hop aromas with a lot of floral and citrus peel notes and maybe a touch of earthiness. A light toffee note with a lot of toasted bread. Unfortunately, the flavor is not very pleasant. Very underattenuated with a malt extract sort of flavor to it. The hop character has almost vanished and very little of the citrus or floral flavors remain, maybe just a bit of grass. Kind of watery on the palate as well.
Pours clear amber with a low head. Aroma is malts, fruits and some hops. Flavor is fruity malts with a hoppy finish. Its a bit watery and has no finish, but for the ABV its awesome.
Pours clear amber with medium head. Aroma is citrus fruits, exotic fruits, hops and hint of bubble gum. Flavor is fruits and hops. Flavor is hops and fruits. Of course no body.
Bottle from Brewdog shop. Copper color, white head. Bitter taste with much hops, minerals and grapefruit. Somewhat unbalanced body. Extreme dry hoppy finish. Intense brew for such low ABV.

330 ml bottle. The aroma has deliciously fruity notes, with characters of a nice medium light bodied IPA. Its dark brown and slightly cloudy, with medium high livelyness. It also has notes of minerals and chalk. The taste is quite bitter, but watery, with an aftertaste of minerals.
In general this makes it a rather disappointing experience, because the almost perfect aroma "lies" about the rest of the beer.

#1250 // 33 cl. bottle split with Kraddel // an affordable Brewdog gimmick I have been interested in for a while // wow way darker than I expected, surprisingly dark brown amber, decent tanned head, unfortunately bottom carries too many odd ufos for my taste  // smell is very weird, it is pine but it is very strangely sweet, smells a bit like feet, grains and rotting oranges // taste, first thing this is shockingly watery, almost like plain water, very bitter metallic, pine resin, rotting fruits, touch fruit, citrus, plastic, like that electrical thing that kills mosquitoes that I used to have when i was little, ok at first but the more you drink the harder the off-flavors become, it is too much to drink, harsh // very, very watery body // interesting concept perhaps but one that can probably never work and this is obviously not the way to do it if you want to something drinkable, Brewdog IPAs are not that good on their own anyway // american hops are probably not the way to go either, noble perhaps? // glad I didnt have the whole bottle to finish // pure water body

split with 77 ships 
pours very dark, almost brown ! looks wattery in the foam, and the gas in the glass.. light scent, much more taste than expected 
bitter, wattery aftertaste that also contains metalic things in it. in the begining i was like ok, this is better thazn watter or coca cola, but i have to take my words back, even half a glas is simpley to much cause of its borningness and weird kinda aftertaste. a full bottle would just be pushing it !
Aroma of citrus and pineapple. A good bitterness at the end. Really nice considering its low alcohol content.

A amazing beer I drink some bottles (1-3) every week.
I think its the perfect "non alcoholic" beer that is ever made, ofcourse it cant have a nice body since the alcoholic always make the body, but the aroma and bitterness is amazing.

Pours dark amber with medium off white head.
Aromas of grape, orange, pine.
Starts out quite nice but moves over to be a bit to watery and very bitter. I miss caramel sweetness and of course alcohol which qould balance this beer better. Overall being a non alcoholic beer its good!

A clear dark red and an off-white substantial head that lasts with coarse lacing. Impressive aroma of hops, citrus and caramel. Taste is clean bitter, some fruit and hops, though the taste diminishes in the finish it is a decent low alcohol beer when the situation demands it; this is one worth having to hand when needs must.

Bottle. Amber, short to average and mostly diminishing head, Light to moderate, malty  lightly grainy and lightly sweetish aroma, light caramel, some tropical fruitiness and some grapefruit - piney hoppyness. Body is light, malty - lightly grainy and dryish flavor, faint caramel, some grapefruit - piney hoppyness. Finish is short, malty and dry, some piney hoppyness. Well...Nice hoppyness considering (watery) body, but...
i thknk this was the precursor to blitz as the 2 are very similar. huge hoppy nose but a bit watery and disappointing elsewhere. cant grumble too much aboout it though. a decent effort.

33cL bottle at brewdog glasgow.  I thought this was a "joke beer" at first, but when I poured it I took it seriously.  It looks very fit, and the aroma is similar to others.  The first taste is awesome, but the end lets you down and just tastes like sour water.  Ah well its an interesting fun beer anyway, especially if youre driving.

Bottle (330ml from Brewdog.com):
Hopped up to begin with along with some floral notes and a touch of tea which I wasnt expecting. It is quite strong at points and there is some background pine and a bit of grapefruit.

Reddish to murky brown colour with tinges of orange in it as well. It is topped buy a foamy white head about the width of a thumb.

Bland right at the start with touches of hops and pine but these are pretty minimal. There is a lot of bitter that follows this and again some floral notes but thats about it really. Not a great taste and in fact barely drinkable.

Incredibly dry on the palate along with being quite bland and almost watery if that is even possible. The beer is light bodied with low to mild carbonation.

Started out really well and I was beginning to think there was actually a low alcohol beer out there that would be able to compete with some pretty good pale ales however the second I took a taste of it I knew that wasnt the case. A pretty poor beer, up there with the worst if taken on taste alone.

Pours as a light brown beer with a nice head. A strong smell of hops which makes you really want to try this one. The taste is quite good for a low alcohol beer, but nothing more then that. Good for a try.

(Bottle, 0.33 - batch 138, from Systembolage, 20120712) The beer poured mahogany coloured and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had pine, fruitiness and hops in general. Palate was light bodied with high carbonation. Flavours were hops, pine, grass, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy and bitter. The aroma and the taste were good but the body was too thin.
The head is ok, the color brown-red. The taste is very intensive hoppy, different hops, aromatical. In the aftertaste it is also very hoppy and bitter. Fantastic low alcohol beer! 12/12/11/13/12/13
Bottle at Rover, Gothenburg. Nice amber color with a big creamy offwhite head. Hoppy, sweet a bit oily aroma. Hoppy and spicy flavour. This is one of the bestlow alcohol beers I ever tasted.

26th March 2010Clear brown beer. Light cream head. Nice hoppy nose. Palate is inevitably a bit thin. Good strong hop flavour - grapefruit and a little tea. Not a beer I would seek out but would be more than happy to sup a few if I had to drive.
Bottle. Amber brown colour. Surprisingly strong aroma of hops. Taste of liquorice. Very good for a low alcohol beer.
Smells and looks better than it tastes. But as light beers go its a flavor bomb. .......

Bottle shared by bsuedekum, originally sent Stateside by cgarvieuk- thanks, Blake and Craig! Pours a nice, deep, clear amber color with a finger of off-white head that dissipates quickly. Surprising amount going on in the aroma, with leafy hops, crackers, toast, caramel malts, and a little grapefruit. The flavor is faint by comparison, with earthy bitterness, tea leaves, and a long mineral note. Light-bodied, with low carbonation and a mineral mouthfeel. Surprising bitterness. Watery. I dont really know how to rate this, except that it is great for 0.5%.

Pours a dark amber colour with a tall frothy off-white head. Aroma is pretty much all hops with notes of orange and citrus. Taste is also very dry and hoppy with the same citrusy-orange notes. It could use a lot more malt! Although of course, that would defeat the purpose of a low alcohol beer. I wish I couldve tried the other Nanny State. Definitely the best low alcohol beer Ive tasted.
This is the best Low Alc. by far of all I have tasted. No doubt. Great hops and great effect as there is now alcohol making you sleepy.I want more of this.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2013 Orland bottle brought back. Pretty serious looking pour; amber-brown with a big foamy head.  Nice aroma too, caramel malt with a hint of hops. The flavor starts okay but then finishes watery. Two outta three aint bad for such a little beer. I would buy buckets of this compared to any other NA I have tried...and remember Ive been pregnant twice and forced to seek out NAs.

Post work beer, damn it feels good. Pours copper with a small egg shell white head. Aroma is full of centennial and columbus hops - citrus, grapefruit and a bit pine. A small hint of bread crust malts. Very simple and easy going. Taste is very hoppy with lots of citrus and grapefruit and a resinous quality, turning over into a harsh bitterness and a bit of astringency. The malt is pretty much gone in the taste, with the exception of a small dark grain note. Obviously the body is totally thin, but its quite refreshing and pretty much just the drink I need right now.
MY absolute favourite beer. It tastes richly of the citrustones and the freshness from the Amarillo.A standard in the swedish systembolag.
Well well, Unique. Standard pale ale aroma. Thin spritzy palate that youd expect from 0.5%. Aftertaste a bit bitter, left over coffee grounds. At least it has some flavour for low alc beer

Bottle from Asahiya. Big hoppy nose, lots of citrus and grass, pine and hay. Light caramel is also somehow coming through, plus coffee. Deep amber. Brown with a fluffy, low head. Looks great.
Very light malt, flavor, lots of coffee, like the ground somewhat, hay, grass, pine. Certainly not as nice as the nose, but still likeable, and full of character. Very bitter finish. Body is surely too light but hey, thats life. The finish is a bit astringent and nasty, though. The best 0.5% beer Ive had by a long ways. I would drink it all the time if I could get it cheaply (I mean soda prices!)
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Dark brown colour with medium head. Lot of hops is aroma. Flavour is bitter, watery, hoppy. Might not wanna drink many of these on same night thought.

33 cl bottle.
Rated on 20110605.
Pours dark copper color with medium-sized head. Aroma of mild hoppy fruits. Flavor of dry hay and fruits. Very bitter palate. Surprisingly good.
